SourceText: â–¶ï¸ Start by wiggling your babyâ€™s toes or fingers one at a time while counting them, saying your own silly rhyme, or simply naming the toes and fingers: â€œTickle your tiny toe!â€ or â€œHello little thumb!â€
text: â–¶ï¸ Qala ngokunyakazisa izinzwane noma iminwe ngakunye ngakunye ngesikhathi ubala, ube uzisholo ingoma yakho ehlekisayo, noma usho izinzwane neminwe ngamagama" Kitaza ucikicane" noma "Sawubona sthupha esincane!"

text: *Izindaba nigonene*

text: Akusheshile ukuxoxa indaba! ğŸ“–

text: Uma umfundela indaba esencwadini, ungakhomba izithombe futhi uchaze okubonayo: "Buka, inja! Inja idlala ngaphandle."

SourceText: Story telling builds language, imagination, and a love of stories and reading - right from the start. And cuddling up together makes it even more special âœ¨
text: Ukuxoxelana izindaba kwakha ulimi, umcabango, ukuthanda izingxoxo kanye nokufunda - kusaqala. Futhi kwenza nokugonana kube okukhethekile kakhulu âœ¨

text: ğŸ‘‚ Yisho ukuthi yini: "Hlofo, hlofo! Isikhwama lesi" noma "Khence khence! Okhiye laba "Buka ukuthi ingane yakho izokwenzenjani - ingabe iphendukela ngalapho ekunomsindo khona? Ingabe uyamamatheka noma uyacwayiza?

SourceText: *Playtime with Books*
text: *Isikhathi Sokudlala Ngezincwadi*

SourceText: Reading to your baby from birth is a beautiful way to bond and support their development - even before they understand the words ğŸ“–

SourceText: â° Choose a quiet moment, turn off distractions like TV and phones, and pick a baby-friendly book or even an old magazine or newspaper you have lying around!

SourceText: ğŸ”„ If possible, start a regular routine to read together when your child isnâ€™t too tired or hungry.Reading together for a few minutes a day is one of the best ways to help your child learn words and connect with you!
text: ğŸ”„ Uma kungenzeka, qala wenze kube yinjwayelo ukufunda ndawonye uma ingane yakho ingakhathele kakhulu noma ingalambile. Ukufunda ndawonye imizuzu embalwa ngosuku indlela enhle yokusiza ingane ukufunda amagama nokuxhumana nawe!

SourceText: Link things in the books to your child's life, and use words about emotions and talk about them! ğŸ˜ƒ.
text: Qondanisa izinto encwadini nempilo yomntwana wakho, futhi usebenzise amagama emizwa bese ukhuluma ngawo! ğŸ˜ƒ.

SourceText: *Animal Acting*
text: *Ukulingisa isilwane*

SourceText: Get ready to roar like a lion or hop like a kangaroo! ğŸ§¸
text: Lungela ukubhonga njengebhubesi noma ukugxuma njenge kangaroo! ğŸ§¸

SourceText: ğŸ“ To start, write the names of animals on small pieces of paper and put them in a box or container.
text: ğŸ“ Qala ngokubhala amagama ezilwane kwiziqeshana zamaphepha uwafake ebhokisini noma esitsheni.

SourceText: ğŸ‘‹ Take turns picking a piece of paper and acting out the animal - can you mimic its sounds and movements? Roar, jump, crawl, or fly just like the animal you picked!
text: ğŸ‘‹ Shintshanani ngokucosha iphepha bese nilingisela leso silwane - Ungakwazi ukulingisela umsindo nomnyakazo waso? Ukubhonga, ukugxuma, ukukhasa noma ukundiza njengaleso silwane osikhethile!

SourceText: ğŸ‰ For older kids, turn it into a fun guessing game - see if others can guess which animal youâ€™re pretending to be!
text: ğŸ‰ Izingane esezikhulile, zingawenza kube umdlalo omnandi wokuqagela - bona ukuthi nabanye bangakwazi ukuqagela isilwane osilingisayo!

SourceText: This active game helps kids develop physical skills while also supporting speech and language development in a fun way ğŸ’š
text: Lomdlalo onomnyakazo usiza izingane ekuthuthukiseni amakhono omzimba, ngalesosikhathi weseka ukuthuthukisa ulimi nokukhuluma ngendlela emnandi ğŸ’š

SourceText: *Freeze Dance*
text: *Umdanso wokuma unganyakazi*

SourceText: Get ready to dance and freeze with this exciting activity that toddlers love! ğŸµ
text: Lungela ukudansa bese uyama unganyakazi ngalomsebenzi ojabulisayo othandwa izingane ezincane! ğŸµ

SourceText: ğŸ“» Play some music and let your child dance or move however they like.
text: ğŸ“» Dlala umculo bese uyekela ingane yakho idanse noma inyakaze ngendlela ethanda ngayo.

SourceText: â¸ When the music stops, tell them to freeze â€“ to not move at all! â€“ in one place.
text: â¸ Uma umculo uthula, itshele ime inganyakazi - inganyakazi nhlobo! - ime endaweni eyodwa.

SourceText: This fun game is great for building listening skills and self-control as they practise stopping and starting âœ¨
text: Lomdlalo ojabulisayo muhle ukwakheni amakhono okulalela nokuzithiba ngenkathi bephrakthiza ukuma nokuqala âœ¨

SourceText: Itâ€™s also a wonderful way to prepare for school, where theyâ€™ll need to follow directions ğŸ”‘
text: Kuyindlela enhle ukulungiselela isikole, uma sekudingeka ukulandela umkhombandlela ğŸ”‘

SourceText: So, turn up the music and enjoy the dancing â€“ and the freezing! ğŸ’š
text: Khuphula umsindo womculo uthokozele ukudansa - nokuma! ğŸ’š

SourceText: *Mystery Bag*
text: *Isikhwama Semfihlakalo*

SourceText: This game is easy and perfect for engaging your toddlerâ€™s senses and learning new words ğŸ
text: Lomdlalo ulula futhi ukulungele ukuxhumisa imizwa yengane yakho encane nokufunda amagama amasha ğŸ

SourceText: ğŸ† Simply place different objects into a bag and ask your child to reach in, feel an item, and guess what it is before pulling it out.
text: ğŸ† Faka izinto ezihlukene esikhwameni bese ucela ingane yakho ukuthi ifake isandla, ezwe izinto, bese iqagela ukuthi yini ngaphambi kokuyikhipha.

SourceText: ğŸ‘‹ When they pull out the item, ask them questions to describe what they see: Is it smooth or scary? Bumpy or bright?
text: ğŸ‘‹ Uma ikhipha okungaphakathi, yibuze imibuzo ichaze ekubonayo: Ingabe kubushelelezi noma kuyathusa? Kunamabhamp noma kuqhakazile?

SourceText: Itâ€™s a fun way to introduce new words and stimulate their sense of touch! ğŸ’¡
text: Kuyindlela ejabulisayo yokuveza amagama amasha nokuvuselela umuzwa wakhe wokuthinta! ğŸ’¡

SourceText: Benefits of this activity include expanding vocabulary, developing tactile senses, and practising grouping skills. Itâ€™s a wonderful way to mix fun with learning! ğŸ‰
text: Inzuzo enhle yalomsebenzi ifaka ukwandisa amagama asetshenziswayo, ukukhulisa izinzwana nokuphrakhthiza amakhono okuhlanganisa ngamaqoqo. Kuyindlela enhle yokuhlanganisa injabulo nokufunda! ğŸ‰

SourceText: Adapted from British Council: https://learnenglishkids.britishcouncil.org/parents/top-tips/mystery-bag-game
text: Iguqulwe kususelwa ku- British Council: https://learnenglishkids.britishcouncil.org/parents/top-tips/mystery-bag-game

SourceText: *Body Outline*
text: *Amalungu Omzimba*

SourceText: This fun and interactive game helps your toddler learn about different parts of the body ğŸ§¸
text: Lomdlalo ojabulisayo usiza ingane yakho encane ukufunda ngamalungu omzimba ahlukene ğŸ§¸

SourceText: ğŸ“ Start by drawing their body outline on a large piece of paper or with a stick on the ground.
text: ğŸ“ Qala ngokudweba amalungu omzimba ephepheni elikhulu noma ngothi emhlabathini.

SourceText: ğŸ‘‚ As you go, ask them to point to and name different body parts. For example, you can say, â€œWhereâ€™s your nose?â€ or â€œCan you point to your feet?â€
text: ğŸ‘‚ Usaqhubeka yicele ukuthi ikhombe futhi isho amagama amalungu omzimba. Isibonelo, ungathi, "Liphi ikhala lakho? noma " Ungazikhomba izinyawo zakho?"

SourceText: ğŸ‘‹As they point, encourage them to name each part.
text: ğŸ‘‹ Ngenkthi ikhomba, yigqugquzele ukuthi ilisho ngegama ilungu ngalinye.

SourceText: ğŸ¨ When you are done, you can colour in the outline or decorate it with anything you have in or around the house to make it more creative and engaging!
text: ğŸ¨ Uma seniqedile, ningafaka umbala nisihlobise isithombe nanoma ingani onayo endlini ukusenza sibukeke kahle futhi sihehe!

SourceText: This fun and creative activity helps your child improve their body awareness, learn new words, and develop fine motor skills ğŸ’¡
text: Lomdlalo onobuhlakani usiza ingane ukukhuliseni ukuqaphela umzimba wayo, ukufunda amagama amasha, nokufunda amakhono okusebenzisa umqondo amalungu amancane omzimba ğŸ’¡

SourceText: *Paper Ball Game*
text: *Umdlalo Webhola Lephepha*

SourceText: Get ready to practice your childâ€™s aim and physical coordination as you play with paper balls together ğŸ”·
text: Lungela ukuphrakthiza ukuqondanisa nokuhlela ngenkathi nidlala ngebhola lephepha ndawonye ğŸ”·

SourceText: ğŸ“ Hereâ€™s what youâ€™ll need: paper (to scrunch up into balls), and crayons.
text: ğŸ“ Nakhu okudingayo: iphepha ( ulifohloze wenze ibhola), namakhrayoni.

SourceText: ğŸ¨ Start by colouring each piece of paper so that it is a unique colour. Now scrunch up the paper until you have a paper ball.
text: ğŸ¨ Qala ngokufaka umbala ohlukile kwiphepha ngalinye. Manje hlofoza iphepha uze ube nebhola lephepha.

SourceText: ğŸš© Next, make a goal. You can use markings that already exist, or a clear table surface.
text: ğŸš© Okulandelayo yenza ipali. Ungasebenzisa omaka asebevele bekhona noma itafula eliqoqiwe.

SourceText: ğŸ… Now youâ€™re ready to play! Take turns tossing your ball towards the goal. Whoever scores or lands closest to the goal wins the round!
text: ğŸ… Manje senikulungele ukudlala! Shintshanani ukugingqa ibhola uyofaka igoli. Okorile uwina loyo mzuliswano!

SourceText: This fun and engaging game is perfect for boosting your childâ€™s physical coordination and decision-making skills while keeping them entertained. Let the friendly competition begin! â­
text: Lomdlalo ojabulisayo ulungele ukukhulisa ikhono lokunyakazisa umzimba ngendlela efanele lokho ekwenzayo namakhono okuthatha izinqumo ngenkathi ibagcina bejabule. Awuqale umncintiswano wobungani! â­

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/jumping-caps
text: Iguqulwe kususelwa ku Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/jumping-caps

SourceText: *Letter in the Shop*
text: *Incwadi Esitolo*

SourceText: Turn your next trip to the store into a learning adventure! ğŸ
text: Yenza indlela yenu elandelayo niya esitolo kube uhambo lokufunda ğŸ

SourceText: ğŸ… As you shop, pick a letter and talk about the items on your shopping list that start with that letter.
text: ğŸ… Ngesikhathi uthenga esitolo khetha ialfabhethi ukhulume ngezinto ozozithenga ezikuhlu lokuthenga eziqala ngaleyo alfabhethi.

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ Ask your child to find other things in the shop that start with the same letter.
text: ğŸ‘€ Cela ingane yakho ukuthi ithole ezinye izinto esitolo ezinamagama aqala ngaleyo alfabhethi.

SourceText: This simple activity helps build your childâ€™s letter recognition and vocabulary while keeping them engaged during the shopping trip âœ¨
text: Lomsebenzi olula usiza ukwakha ukuqaphela ama alfabhethi nolimi olusetshenziswayo ngesikhathi siyigcina iyingxenye yohambo âœ¨

SourceText: Itâ€™s a fun, interactive way to learn about letters and sounds in real-world situations, turning an ordinary task into an exciting educational game! ğŸŒˆ
text: Kuyindlela ejabulisayo exhumanisanayo yokufunda nokuzizwa besemhlabeni wangempela, ukujika umsebenzi ojwayelekile kube umdlalo onesifundo! ğŸŒˆ

SourceText: Adapted from Sesame Workshop: https://sesameworkshop.org/resources/what-will-we-do/
text: Iguqulwe ku Sesame Workshop: https://sesameworkshop.org/resources/what-will-we-do/

SourceText: *Fun with Food*
text: *Injabulo ngo Kudla*

SourceText: Cooking can help your child start learning maths!
text: Ukupheka kungasiza ingane yakho ukuqala ukufunda izibalo!

SourceText: ğŸ’š Invite your child to help you cook for your family, or to help you prepare a colourful fruit salad.
text: ğŸ’š Mema ingane yakho ikusize ukuphekela umndeni, noma ikusize ukulungisa isaladi lezithelo elimibalabala.

SourceText: ğŸ… As you gather the ingredients, ask them to count: 'How many tomatoes do we have?' This builds maths skills and encourages teamwork.
text: ğŸ… Njengoba nisaqoqa izithako, yicele abale: Bangaki otamatisi esinabo? Lokhu kwakha ikhono lezibalo futhi kugqugquzela ukusebenzisana.

SourceText: 5ï¸âƒ£ Help your child to understand adding and subtracting quantities. 'We need five tomatoes, if we have three, how many more do we need?' This makes learning fun!
text: 5ï¸âƒ£ Siza ingane yakho ukuqonda ukwengeza nokuphungula kokuningi. 'Sidinga otamatisi abahlanu, uba sinabathathu, bangaki abanye esibadingayo? Lokhu kwenza ukufunda kujabulise!

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ Letâ€™s make it playful! Ask, 'Which is bigger: the tomato or the onion?' This reinforces comparison skills.
text: ğŸ‘€ Asikwenze kube umdlalo! Buza, 'Ikuphi okukhulu: utamatisi noma u anyanisi?' Lokhu kuqinisa amakhono okuqhathanisa.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Consider planning a weekly cooking night.
text: ğŸ”„ Hlela ukwenza uhlelo lokupheka ntambama lweviki neviki.

SourceText: Cooking strengthens your relationship and builds your childâ€™s confidence. Enjoy your cooking adventure together!
text: Ukupheka kuqinisa ubudlelwane futhi kukhulisa ukuzethemba enganeni yakho. Thokozela ukupheka ndawonye!

SourceText: Adapted from Thrive By Five: https://www.thrivebyfive.com/
text: Iguqulwe kususelwa ku Thrive By Five: https://www.thrivebyfive.com/

SourceText: *Following Instructions*
text: *Ukulandela Imiyalelo*

SourceText: ğŸ‘‚ Play a game in which your child listens to and tries to remember strings of instructions.
text: ğŸ‘‚ Dlala umdlalo lapho ingane yakho ilalela bese izama ukukhumbula imiyalelo.

SourceText: This will be useful in school, at home, and later in life!
text: Lokhu kuzosiza esikoleni, ekhaya, nasempilweni esikhathini esizayo!

SourceText: Start with just one instruction using an object in your home. For example â€œtouch the red ballâ€ ğŸ”´
text: Qala ngomyalelo owodwa usebenzisa into esekhaya lakho. Isibonelo "thinta ibhola elibomvu" ğŸ”´

SourceText: Slowly add more instructions (e.g â€œthen pick up the cup "â˜•), but tell your child that they can only start once youâ€™ve finished giving the instructions.
text: Ungangeza eminye imiyalelo kancane kancane (isbonelo" bese uthatha inkomishi"â˜•), bese utshela ingane yakho ukuthi ingaqala uma usuqedile ukumnika imiyalelo.

SourceText: See how many your child can follow without forgetting!
text: Bheka ukuthi ingane yakho ingalandela emingaki ngaphandle kokukhohlwa!

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Now swap roles! Itâ€™s your childâ€™s turn to give you instructions! They can use the same objects if they want.
text: ğŸ”„ Manje shintshisanani! Sekuyithuba lengane yakho ukuthi ikunike imiyalelo! Ingasebenzisa izinto ezifanayo uma efuna.

SourceText: You can also try this game with a group of children! Make sure they take turns ğŸ˜ƒ
text: Ungawuzama lomdlalo neqembu lezingane! Qinisekisa ukuthi ziyashintshana ğŸ˜ƒ

SourceText: *I Spy Colours!*
text: *Ngipopola Imibala*

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ Choose an object around you and say: â€œI spy with my little eye, something that isâ€¦â€ and say the colour of object, like â€œyellowâ€ or â€œredâ€.
text: ğŸ‘€ Khetha into eseduzane nawe bese uthi: "Ngiyapopola ngehlo lami elincane ukuthi..."usho umbala waleyonto, njengokuthi "phuzi" noma "bomvu."

SourceText: âœ… Encourage your child to look around and guess what the object might be. When they guess correctly, give them praise and switch roles!
text: âœ… Gqugquzela ingane yakho ukuthi iqalaze bese iqagela ukuthi ngabe yini leyo. Uma iqagele kahle, yincome nishintshane ngezindima!

SourceText: ğŸ”‘ If theyâ€™re having trouble, offer clues like, â€œItâ€™s roundâ€ or â€œItâ€™s somewhere in that corner".
text: ğŸ”‘ Uma iba nenkinga, ungayinikeza umkhondo njengokuthi, "iyindilinga" noma "ilaphaya ngasekhoneni".

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Keep the game going with new objects and different colours.
text: ğŸ”„ Qhubekani nomdlalo ngezinto ezintsha ezinemibala ehlukene.

SourceText: This classic game is a fun and interactive way to help your child learn words, observe, and stay concentrated. This will help them at home and in school ğŸ
text: Lomdlalo onemibalabala umnandi futhi unendlela yokuxhumana esiza ingane yakho ukufunda amagama, ukuqaphela ukuhlala ugxilile. Lokhu kuzoyisiza ekhaya nasesikoleni ğŸ

SourceText: *I Spy Letters!*
text: *Ngipopola izincwadi*

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ I spy is a fun game to play with your child that will help them learn about letters and words!
text: ğŸ‘€ Ngipopola umdlalo omnandi ongawudlala nengane yakho ezoyisiza ukufunda ama -alfabhethi namagama!

SourceText: Choose an object or a thing around you, and donâ€™t tell your child what it is. It should be something that your child knows the word for. For example â€œballâ€ âš½
text: Khetha into eduzane nawe, ungayitsheli ingane yakho ukuthi yini leyo. Kufanele kube into ingane yakho eyaziyo igama layo. Isibonelo "ibhola" âš½

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ Then say â€œI spy with my little eye, something beginning with *and then say the first letter of the word* which in this case is â€œbâ€
text: ğŸ‘€ Bese uthi "Ngipopola ngehlo lami elincane, into eqala ngo *bese usho i-alfabethi yokuqala yegama* okungu "b" kulesisimo

SourceText: Your child should look around and guess what the object is. When they guess it right, praise them and swap roles! If they canâ€™t get it, give them some clues, like â€œitâ€™s roundâ€ or â€œitâ€™s black and whiteâ€. âœ…
text: Ingane yakho kumele ibheke eduzane bese iqagela ukuthi yini leyonto. Uma iqagele kahle, yincome bese nishintshana ngezindima! Uma ingaitholi yinike umkhondo njengokuthi "iyindilinga" noma " imnyama nokumhlophe". âœ…

SourceText: Play this game with as many objects as possible and as many different letters! Help your child to learn about the different letters and sounds in words. This will help them learn to read at home and school. ğŸ“
text: Dlala lomdlalo ngezinto eziningi nama - alfabhethi ahlukahlukene! Siza ingane yakho ukufunda ngama - alfabhethi ahlukene nemisindo esemagameni. Lokhu kuzoyisiza ekufundeni ekhaya nasesikoleni. ğŸ“

SourceText: *What Letter is This?*
text: *Iyiphi le Alfabhethi?*

SourceText: Playing games with letters can help your child learn the alphabet and how letters are put together to make words.
text: Ukudlala imidlalo ngamagama kungasiza ingane yakho ukufunda ahlanganiswa kanjani ama-alfabhethi ukwakha amagama.

SourceText: ğŸ“ Write a letter on a piece of card or paper (e.g. â€œpâ€)
text: ğŸ“ Bhala i-alfabethi eyodwa kwibhodi noma ephepheni (isib. "p")

SourceText: ğŸ‘‚ Say the letter out loud and ask your child to say it too!
text: ğŸ‘‚ Isho i-alfabhethi kakhulu bese ucela ingane yakho isho nayo!

SourceText: Ask your child to say some words that begin with the letter â€œpâ€, give them clues like â€œWhat starts with â€œpâ€? Plantâ€¦ What else? ğŸŒ±
text: Cela ingane yakho ukuthi isho amagama aqala ngo-alfabethi u-"t", yiphe umkhondo njengokuthi "Yini eqala ngo-"t"? Tshala... Yini okunye? ğŸŒ±

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ Ask your child to look for objects in your house that begin with a letter (eg â€œpâ€ for plate). Help them find things.
text: ğŸ‘€ Cela ingane yakho ukuthi ibheke izinto endlini eziqala nge alfabhethi (isbonelo "p" we puleti). Yisize ukuthola izinto.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Try a new letter every day!
text: ğŸ”„ Zama i-alfabhethi eyodwa futh entsha ngosuku!

SourceText: *Riddles Time*
text: *Isikhathi Sokuphicaphicana*

SourceText: Riddles and puzzles are a fun way to build thinking skills! ğŸ’¡
text: Iziphicaphicano namaphazili ayindlela ejabulisayo yokwakha ikhono lokucabanga! ğŸ’¡

SourceText: Do you remember any riddles from your childhood? If you canâ€™t then make one up, they can be very simple! ğŸ˜ƒ
text: Uyazikhumbula iziphicaphicana zasebuntwaneni bakho? Uma uhluleka, yakha eyodwa, ingaba lula kakhulu! ğŸ˜ƒ

SourceText: Like â€œWhat can you see at night but not in the dayâ€ Answer: â€œThe moonâ€ ğŸŒ™
text: Njengokuthi "Yini ongayibona ebusuku kodwa ayiveli emini" Impendulo: "Inyanga" ğŸŒ™

SourceText: If your child is finding them difficult, try an easy one like: â€œWhat is round, bouncy and can be thrown or kicked?â€ Answer: â€œA ballâ€ âš½
text: Uma ingane yakho ihluleka, zama esilula njengokuthi: "Yini eyindilinga ephonswayo noma ekhahlelwayo?"Impendulo: "Ibhola" âš½

SourceText: Your child can also try making riddles! ğŸ’¡
text: Ingane yakho nayo ingazama ukuphicaphica! ğŸ’¡

SourceText: You can have fun with riddles anywhere at any time - like traveling on a bus, walking to school or in a car ğŸš—
text: Ningazijabulisa ngeziphicaphicano noma inini nanoma ikuphi - njengokuhamba ngebhasi, ukuhamba ngezinyawo ukuya esikoleni noma phakathi kwemoto ğŸš—

SourceText: *Make up a Story*
text: *Yakha Indaba*

SourceText: Creating stories together is a great way to have fun with imagination - and to build your childâ€™s creativity! ğŸ“–
text: Ukwakha izindaba ndawonye indlela enhle yokuzijabulisa ngomcabango - nokwakha ubuhlakani enganeni yakho! ğŸ“–

SourceText: 5ï¸âƒ£ With your child, come up with 5 words to use. They can be any words you want! For example: banana, spaceship, fish, water, painting, cooking, wedding. If you need to remember them, write them clearly on a paper with your child.
text: 5ï¸âƒ£ Ungaqhamuka namagama awu 5 ozowasebenzisa nengane yakho. Kungaba inoba imaphi amagama owafunayo wena! Isibonelo: ubhanana, umkhumbi, ufishi, isithombe esidwetshiwe sapendwa, ukupheka, umshado. Uma ufuna ukuwakhumbula wabhale ngokucacile ephepheni nengane yakho.

SourceText: ğŸ‚ Start your story with, â€œOnce upon a time, there was aâ€¦â€ and use one of the words from the list in the first part. For example, â€œOnce upon a time, there was a family who worked on a *banana* farm.â€
text: ğŸ‚ Qala indaba yakho ngokuthi, "Kwasukasukela, kwakukhona i..." bese uqinisekakisa ukuthi usebenzisa elilodwa igama kuhlu lwakho. Isibonelo, "Kwasukasukela, kwakukhona umndeni owawusebenza efamu *labhanana*."

SourceText: ğŸ“ Let your child make up the next part using another word from the list.
text: ğŸ“ Dedela ingane yakho icabange umusho ngokusebenzisa elinye igama kuloluhlu.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Take turns until you have used all the words and created a story.
text: ğŸ”„ Shintshisanani nize nisebenzise wonke amagama futhi seniyakhile indaba.

SourceText: ğŸ”” Be creative and do not tell your child what to say. It does not need to be a real story to be fun!
text: ğŸ”” Yiba nobuhlakani futhi ungayitsheli ingane yakho ukuthi ithini. Akudingeki ukuthi kube indaba yangempela ukuze ijabulise!

SourceText: ğŸ Ask your child what their favourite part of the story was, and tell them yours!
text: ğŸ Buza ingane yakho ukuthi iyiphi ingxenye eyithandile kulendaba, nawe uyitshele eyakho!

SourceText: *Playing with Clothes*
text: *Ukudlala Ngezimpahla*

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ Clothes can be the perfect â€˜toysâ€™ to help your child build fine motor skills, recognise colours, and think! Here are 3 ideas you can try:
text: ğŸ’¡ Izingubo zokugqoka zingakulungela ukuba amathoyizi ukulekelela ukwakha amakhono okuphila, ukuqaphela imibala nokucabanga: Nansi imibono ewu 3 ongayizama:

SourceText: ğŸ‘‹ Practice
text: ğŸ‘‹Phrakhthiza

SourceText: Help your child exercise their fingers by showing them how buttons and zips work on clothes, and letting them practise using them!
text: Siza ingane yakho ukuvocavoca iminwe ngokuyikhombisa ukuthi izinkinobho noziphu zisebenza kanjani ezimpahleni, bese uyayidedela iphrakthize ukuzisebenzisa!

SourceText: ğŸ”µ Colours
text: ğŸ”µ Imibala

SourceText: Talk about the colours of clothes! Ask your child to name the colours of their clothes and talk about all the things that are that colour: â€œWhat are all the things we can think of that are blue?â€
text: Khulumani ngemibala yezimpahla! Buza ingane yakho ngemibala yezimpahla niphinde nikhulume nangezinye izinto ezinaloyo mbala: "Yiziphi ezinye izinto esingazicabanga eziwumbala oluhlaza njengesibhakabhaka?"

SourceText: ğŸ”¶ Sorting

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ Remembering Instructions
text: ğŸ’¡ Ukukhumbula Imiyalelo

SourceText: Take turns to give 2-3 instructions that the other person has to follow. Make sure physical movement is included!
text: Shintshanani ngokunikana imiyalelo ewu 2-3 omunye umuntu kumele ayilandele. Qinisekakisa ukuthi umnyakazo womzimba uyingxenye yalokhu!

SourceText: For example:
text: Isibonelo:

SourceText: - Hop twice, then turn around.
text: - Gxuma-gxuma kancane kabili, phenduka.

SourceText: - Jump to the kitchen, pick up a spoon, then run back. âœ…
text: - Gxumela ekhishini, cosha isipuni, bese ugijima ubuyele emuva. âœ…

SourceText: These active games builds memory, coordination, and listening skills - helping your child follow instructions while moving their body ğŸ‘‹

SourceText: *Thinking Games*
text: *Imidlalo Yokucabanga*

SourceText: Letâ€™s play some games to help your child think and follow instructions!
text: Masidlale imidlalo ukusiza ingane yakho ukucabanga nokulandela imiyalelo!

SourceText: â— Mama/Daddy says!
text: â— Mama/Baba uthi!

SourceText: Give your child brief instructions to follow, by saying: â€œMama/daddy saysâ€¦ touch your headâ€.
text: Nika ingane yakho imiyalelo emifishane ukuze iyilandele, njengokuthi "Umama/baba uthi..... thinta ikhanda lakho".

SourceText: â€œMama/daddy saysâ€¦ jump twiceâ€.
text: "Umama/ubaba uthi... gxuma kabili"

SourceText: Once your child understands the game well, you can make it more complicated!
text: Uma ingane yakho isiwuqonda kahle umdlalo, ungawenza ube nzinyana!

SourceText: â€œMama/daddy saysâ€¦ jump, then clap and sitâ€.
text: "Umama/ubaba uthi... gxuma, bese ushaya izandla futhi uhlala phansi".

SourceText: ğŸ”µ ğŸ”´ Blue-Red
text: ğŸ”µ ğŸ”´ Luhlaza okwesibhakabhaka - Bomvu

SourceText: Say a colour, and your child needs to quickly find and touch something of that colour.
text: Isho umbala, bese ingane yakho kumele isheshe iyothinta into onaloyo mbala.

SourceText: To make the game harder, you can choose two colours and tell your child they should touch the opposite colour!
text: Ukwenza umdlalo ubenzinyana, ungakhetha imibala emibili bese utshela ingane yakho ukuthi ithinte umbala ophambene nalona owushilo!

SourceText: â€œIf I say blue, you should touch something red. If I say red, you need to touch something blue.â€
text: "Uma ngithi oluhlaza njengesibhakabhaka wena uthinta into ebomvu. Uma ngithi bomvu, kumele uthinte into eluhlaza njengesibhakabhaka".

SourceText: Try these games to help your child build listening skills, follow instructions, and have fun - all at the same time!
text: Zama lemidlalo khona kuzosiza ingane yakho ukwakha amakhono okulalela, ukulandela imiyalelo, nokujabula - konke ngesikhathi esisodwa!

SourceText: ğŸ‘‚ Go and stop

text: Ithi: Uma ngithi "ima", asinyakazi. Uma ngithi "hamba", singahamba futhi.

SourceText: *Games with Pictures!*
text: *Imidlalo Enezithombe!*

SourceText: Any picture or image can turn into a game:
text: Noma isiphi isithombe singaphenduka umdlalo:

SourceText: ğŸ‘‚ Making up a story
text: ğŸ‘‚ Ukuqamba indaba

SourceText: Find a picture with people or animals in an old newspaper, book, or magazine, or on packaging.
text: Thola isithombe esinabantu noma izilwane kwiphephandaba elidala, incwadi, noma imagazini, noma ephaketheni.

SourceText: Say: â€œLetâ€™s make up a story about this picture. I can start. This little girl is feeling very excited today. Why do you think she is feeling excited?â€
text: Ngokwesibonelo, ithi: Sizokwakha indaba mayelana nalesi sithombe. Ngingaqala. Le ntombazane encane izizwa ijabule kakhulu namhlanje. Ucabanga ukuthi kungani izizwa ijabulile?

SourceText: ğŸ˜ƒ â€œShe is holding her bag and has a big smile. Where do you think she is going?â€
text: ğŸ˜ƒ â€œUphethe isikhwama sakhe futhi umamatheka kakhulu. Ucabanga ukuthi uyaphi?â€

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ Can you guess it?
text: ğŸ‘€ Ungaqagela?

SourceText: Say: â€œI am going to describe something on the page and you need to guess what it is and point to itâ€. For example, â€œI see something that is green and moves slowly.
text: Uthi: "Ngizochaza okuthile kulelipheji kumele uqagele ukuthi yini futhi uyikhombe". Isibonelo "Ngibona into eluhlaza enyakaza kancane."

SourceText: Can you guess what it is?â€ ğŸ’š
text: Ungaqagela ukuthi yini?" ğŸ’š

SourceText: These playful games build imagination, language, and thinking skills - while helping your child listen and express their own ideas in a fun way ğŸ’¡
text: Lemidlalo isiza ekwakheni imifanekiso-ngqondweni, ulimi namakhono okucabanga - ngesikhathi isiza ingane yakho ukulalela futhi nokukhuluma ngemibono yayo ngendlela ejabulisayo ğŸ’¡

SourceText: *Tell Me a Story!*
text: *Ngitshele indaba!*

SourceText: ğŸ‘‚ Sit together in a cosy spot and begin a story the traditional way in your home language, like â€œOnce upon a time...â€
text: ğŸ‘‚ Hlalani ndawonye endaweni ethokomele bese uqala indaba ngendlela yakudala ngolimi lwasekhaya. kanje "Kwasuka Sukela..."

SourceText: âœ¨ Use your voice, hands, and expressions to bring the story to life. It could be about animals, a clever child, or a talking tree! Let your child add sounds or repeat words. You can even ask them what happens next!
text: âœ¨ Sebenzisa iphimbo lakho, izandla nokusebenzisa umzimba ukwenza indaba ikholakale. Ingaba ngezilwane, ingane ehlakaniphile noma isihlahla esikhulumayo! Vumela ingane yakho ingeze imsindo noma iphinde amagama. Ungayibuza ukuthi kwenzekani ngokulandelayo!

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ Traditional storytelling builds language, imagination, and cultural identity - and creates beautiful quiet time together.
text: ğŸ’¡ Ukuxoxa indaba ngendlela yakudala kwakha ulimi, ukuba nomfanekiso-ngqondweni nokwazi ngamasiko - futhi kwakha isikhathi esihle esinokuthula ndawonye.

SourceText: *Proverb Play*
text: *Umdlalo Wezaga*

SourceText: Letâ€™s bring wisdom to life through play! âœ¨
text: Masilethe ubuhlakani ngokudlala! âœ¨

SourceText: ğŸŒ± Think of a traditional proverb and act it out together. Pretend to be the animal or act out the scenario of the proverb - use movement, voices, and imagination!
text: ğŸŒ± Cabanga ngesaga sakudala nilingise ndawonye. Yenza sengathi uyisilwane noma ulingise isiqephu sesaga - sebenzisa umnyakazo, iphimbo nomcabango!

SourceText: ğŸ“– Here are some ideas to get you started:
text: ğŸ“– Nansi eminye imibino ukukulekelela ukuqala:

SourceText: - â€œEven an ant can hurt an elephantâ€ - Pretend to be a big stomping elephant, then tiny ants that tickle its feet!
text: - "Noma ngabe intuthwane ilimaza indlovu" - Yenza sengathi uyindlovu enkulu egxobayo, bese izintuthwane ezinyane zikitaza unyawo lwayo!

SourceText: - â€œThe lion doesnâ€™t turn around when a small dog barksâ€ - Be the calm, wise lion ignoring a noisy pup.
text: - "Ibhubesi alijiki uma likhonkothwa inja encane" - Iba ibhubesi elizothile, elihlakaniphile eliziba umsindo womdlwane.

SourceText: - â€œWisdom is like a baobab tree - no one can embrace it aloneâ€ - Stand in a circle and stretch your arms to build a tree together.
text: - "Ubuhlakani bunjenge sihlahla sebaobab - akekho ongasamukela eyedwa" - Yimani nenze isikokela nilule izingalo ukwakha isihlahla ndawonye.

SourceText: - â€œA single bracelet does not jingleâ€ - Clap or tap together and see how much louder it is with more hands!
text: - "Ibhengela uma lilodwa alikhali" - Shayani izandla noma uthinte nibone ungakanani umsindo uma izandla ziningi!

SourceText: ğŸ‘€Ask your child what they think the proverb means.
text: ğŸ‘€ Buza ingane yakho ukuthi icabanga ukuthi isaga sichaza ukuthini.

SourceText: This playful activity helps children explore big ideas like courage, kindness, and teamwork - through their bodies and imagination ğŸ’¡
text: Lomsebenzi onomdlalo usiza ingane ukuthi ihlole imibono emikhulu njenge sibindi, umusa nokusebenzisana - ngokwemizimba nemifanekiso-ngqondweni ğŸ’¡

SourceText: *I'm a Writer!*
text: *Ngingumbhali!*

SourceText: ğŸ“ Have fun being creative with writing!
text: ğŸ“ Zijabulise ngokusungula ukubhala!

SourceText: You and @fields.child_nickname can have fun writing with a pencil and paper, or with a stick and the sand!
text: Wena no@fields.child_nickname ningazijabulisa ngokubhala ngempensela nephepha, noma ngothi nesimhlabathi!
note: Strings like @fields.xxx and @results.yyy should not be translated.

SourceText: If your child doesnâ€™t know how to write letters, encourage them to draw shapes, and try to copy the shapes of letters. ğŸ”µâ–¶ï¸
text: Uma ingane yakho ingakwazi ukubhala ama-alfabhethi, yikhuthaze idwebe amasheyiphu, futhi izame ukukopisha amasheyiphu ama-alfabethi. ğŸ”µâ–¶ï¸

SourceText: When they are more confident, encourage them to write letters and even words. ğŸ˜ƒ
text: Uma inokuzethemba kakhulu, yikhuthaze ukuthi ibhale ama- alfabhethi namagama ğŸ˜ƒ

SourceText: Start showing them how to write their name and other important words for them, like mom, ball or milk.
text: Qala ngoyikhombisa ukuthi libhalwa kanjani igama layo namanye amagama abululekile, njengo mama, ibhola noma ubisi.

SourceText: Show them the simple things that you write - like shopping lists! Show them the words and each of the letters. Let them try to copy the words! ğŸ“–
text: Yitshengise izinto ezilula ozibhalayo - njengohlu lokuthenga! Yitshengise amagama nama-alfabethi akhona. Yidedele izame ukukopisha amagama! ğŸ“–

SourceText: You and your child can have fun writing with a pencil and paper, or with a stick and the sand!
text: Wena nengane yakho ningazijabulisa ngokubhala ngempensela nephepha, noma ngothi nesihlabathi!

SourceText: ğŸ‰This playful writing time builds confidence, creativity, and early literacy - helping your child see that writing is useful and fun.
text: ğŸ‰ Lesikhathi somdlalo wokubhala sakha ukuzithemba, ubuhlakani nokufunda ngokushesha - ukusiza ingane yakho ibone ukuthi ukubhala kubalulekile futhi kuyajabulisa.

SourceText: *A Friendly Chat*
text: *Inkulumo Yobungani*

SourceText: Talk to your child about something that they are interested in! ğŸ˜ƒ
text: Khuluma nengane yakho ngokuthile enentshisekelo kukho! ğŸ˜ƒ

SourceText: ğŸ’š Spending quality time with your child and talking to them every day is a good way to develop a strong relationship.
text: ğŸ’š Ukuchitha isikhathi esikhethekile nengane yakho nokukhuluma nayo nsuku zonke indlela enhle yokwakha ubudlelwane obuqinile.

SourceText: âš½ An easy way to start talking to your child is to ask them about something they are interested in, for example you could talk about topics such as: sports, books, movies, friends, music, celebrities, or school.
text: âš½ Indlela elula yokuqala ukukhuluma nengane yakho ukubuza ngento enentshisekelo yayo, isibonelo ungakhuluma ngezihloko ezifana nezemidlalo, izincwadi, amafilimu, abangani, umculo, usaziwayo noma isikole.

SourceText: ğŸ‘‚ You may not find everything your child shares to be interesting, but itâ€™s important to show enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn.
text: ğŸ‘‚ Ungase ungatholi yonke into ingane yakho eyabelana ngayo ithandeka, kodwa kubalulekile ukukhombisa umdlandla kanye nokulangazelela ukufunda.

SourceText: Talking about their interests builds trust, confidence, and communication skills - and shows your child that what they care about matters to you ğŸ’›
text: Ukukhuluma ngezinto anentshisekelo ngazo kwakha ukuthembana, ukuzigqaja, namakhono okuxoxisana - futhi kukhombisa ingane yakho ukuthi lokhu akukhathalele unendaba nako ğŸ’›

SourceText: *Get Active*
text: *Yiba matasa*

SourceText: Exercise is a great way to spend time together and it is so good for your health.
text: Ukuzivocavoca indlela enhle yokuchitha isikhathi ndawonye futhi kuyilungele impilo yakho.

SourceText: ğŸŒ± Find a sport or exercise that both you and your child want to do and try it out together!
text: ğŸŒ± Thola umdlalo noma nizivocavoce wena nengane yakho futhi nizame ukukwenza lokhu ndawonye!

SourceText: â° Even walking for 10 minutes a day is good for you.
text: â° Ukuhamba noma imizuzu ewu- 10 ngosuku kukulungele.

SourceText: âš½ Together you can walk, run, play soccer, swim, dance, or do any other sport.
text: âš½ Ningahamba, nigijime, nidlale ibhola, nibhukude, nidanse, noma nenze omunye umdlalo ndawonye.

SourceText: ğŸ† Together, think of ways to make it even more fun. Can you jog to a certain point? Take turns being the coach? Can there be a small, free reward, like getting to decide the next activity?
text: ğŸ† Ndawonye, cabangani izindlela zokwenza kubemnandi kakhulu. Ningagigjima kancane nize nifike endaweni ethize? Nishintshisane ngokuba ngumqeqeshi? Kungaba nomklomelo omncane, omahhala njengokukhetha into eningayenza elandelayo?

SourceText: ğŸŒˆ Exercise becomes easier and more enjoyable the more you do it.
text: ğŸŒˆ Ukuzivocavoca kubalula futhi kuba mnandi mawuqhubeka ukwenza.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ If you or your child do not like the first exercise you pick, try a new exercise.
text: ğŸ”„ Uma wena nengane yakho ningawuthandi umsebenzi wokuqala eniwukhethile, zamani umsebenzi omusha.

SourceText: *Pass the Ball*
text: *Dlulisa Ibhola*

SourceText: Games are a great, fun way to spend time with your family!
text: Imidlalo ayindlela enhle, ejabulisanayo ukuchitha isikhathi nomndeni wakho!

SourceText: 3ï¸âƒ£ This game is best with at least 3 people.
text: 3ï¸âƒ£ Lo mdlalo ulungele abantu abawu- 3 kuyela phezulu.

SourceText: âš½ Find a ball to play. If you cannot find a ball, choose an item you can safely throw around. For example, a bottle cap or a plastic cup.
text: âš½ Thola ibhola lokudlala. Uma ungalitholi ibhola, khetha into ephephile ongakwazi ukuyiphonsa. Isibonelo, isivalo sebhodlela noma inkomishi yeplastiki.

SourceText: â¡ï¸ Start in a circle and pass the ball around.
text: â¡ï¸ Qalani endingilizini bese nidluliselana ibhola.

SourceText: ğŸ‘‹ Start throwing the ball in new directions (up, down, straight, curved, rolling on the ground) and with different forces (hard, soft, medium). You can bounce the ball, throw it in the air, and catch it a few times before passing it.
text: ğŸ‘‹ Qala uphonse ibhola ngezindlela ezihlukile (phezulu, phansi, phambili, indlela egobile, ulirole phansi) futhi ngamandla ahlukile (ngokuqina, ngokuthamba, ngendlela ephakathi). Ungagxumimisa ibhola, uliphonse emoyeni, bese ulibamba kaningi ngaphambi kokulidlulisa.

SourceText: âœ¨ When everyone gets good at catching the ball, you can start moving around the room, still passing the ball.
text: âœ¨ Uma bonke abantu sebelibamba kahle ibhola, ungaqala ukuhamba-hamba egumbini, usaqhubeka udlulisa ngokuphonsa ibhola.

SourceText: â­ Can you throw the ball under the leg? Behind the back? Over your head? Block a pass? Have fun with it!

text: â“ Cela ingane yakho ukuthi icabange ikhono elisha, elimnandi eningalifunda ndawonye.

SourceText: For example: keeping a ball in the air with your foot, juggling, making soup, moonwalking, whistling, saying the alphabet backwards, learning all the countries in Africa.

SourceText: Letâ€™s jump into a classic game! â˜€ï¸
text: Masigxumele kumdlalo wezikwele! â˜€ï¸

SourceText: ğŸ”· Draw a hopscotch grid on the ground using chalk, a stick in the sand, or even tape on the floor indoors. Number the squares from 1 to 9.
text: ğŸ”· Dweba izikwele phansi ngoshokhi, ngokhuni esihlabathini, noma iselothephi phansi endlini. Bhala izinamba ezikweleni ukusuka ku 1 kuya ku 9.

SourceText: â¬†ï¸ Then they hop through the squares on one footâ€”skipping the square with the markerâ€”then turn around and come back.
text: â¬†ï¸ Bese iyagxuma ezikweleni ngonyawo olulodwa - ijomba isikwele esimakiwe - bese iyajika ibuyele emuva.

SourceText: â¬‡ï¸ Stop to pick up the marker on the way back, still hopping!
text: â¬‡ï¸ Ima ukuze ucoshe imakha endleni ebuyayo, usagxuma!

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Next round: throw the marker into square 2... and so on.
text: ğŸ”„ Umzukiswano olandelayo: phonsa imakha esikweleni sesibili... njalo njalo.

SourceText: *Letter Hunt*
text: *Ukuzingelwa KwamaAlfabhethi*

SourceText: Turn your home into a scavenger hunt with this fun and interactive letter game âœ…
text: Phendula ikhaya lakho indawo yokufuna izinto ezilahlekile nomdlalo wokuhlanganyela wama-alfabhethi âœ…

SourceText: ğŸ“ Here is what you need: paper and a pen.
text: ğŸ“ Nakhu okudingayo: iphepha nepeni.

SourceText: 1ï¸âƒ£ Start by writing down each letter of the alphabet - one letter per piece of paper. Once you are done, place the papers face down so you canâ€™t see the letters.
text: 1ï¸âƒ£ Qala ngokubhala i-alfabhethi ngayinye - i-alfabhethi eyodwa ephepheni ngalinye. Uma usuqedile, beka amaphepha uwabhekise phansi ukuze ungakwazi ukubona ama- alfabhethi.

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ Now, turn over one piece of paper to reveal a letter. The challenge? Find objects around your house that begin with that letter! Once you've found an item, place it next to the letter on the paper.
text: ğŸ‘€ Manje usungaphendula iphepha ngalinye ukuze kuzovela i-alfabhethi. Inselelo? Thola izinto ekhaya lakho ezinegama eliqala ngaleyo alfabhethi! Uma uke wayithola into, ibeke eceleni kwe-alfabhethi esephepheni.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Keep the hunt going! Flip over the next letter and search for another object. Continue until youâ€™ve gone through all the letters.
text: ğŸ”„ Makuqhubeke ukuzingela! Phenya i-alfabhethi elandelayo bese ufuna enye into. Qhubeka uze uwabone wonke ama- alfabhethi.

SourceText: This activity is perfect for blending learning with active play, while giving your little ones a fun way to practise their alphabet and creativity! ğŸ’¡
text: Lomsebenzi ulungele ukuhlanganisa isifundo nokudlala, ngesikhathi unika ingane yakho indlela enentokozo ukuthi aphrakthize ama-alfabhethi nobuhlakani! ğŸ’¡

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/what-we-see
text: Iguqulwe kususelwa ku Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/what-we-see

SourceText: *Hot or cold*
text: *Kuyashisa noma Kuyabanda*

SourceText: Ready to hunt for hidden treasure using clues? ğŸ
text: Ukulungele ukuzingela umkhondo womcebo ofihliwe? ğŸ

SourceText: âš½ Hereâ€™s what youâ€™ll need: something easy to hide, like toys or balls.
text: âš½ Nakhu ozokudinga: into ekulula ukuyifihla, njengethoyizi noma amabhola.

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ One player hides an object, while the others close their eyes. The player who hid the object will now give clues to help the others find it.
text: ğŸ‘€ Umdlali oyedwa ufihla into, ngesikhathi abanye bevale amehlo. Umdlali oyifihlile into uzobanika umkhondo abanye ukubasiza ukuthi bayithole.

SourceText: â˜€ï¸ When the person searching is getting close to where the object is hidden, the hider can say â€œgetting warm!â€ or â€œhot!â€, and when the searcher is going in the wrong direction, the hider can say â€œgetting colderâ€¦â€.
text: â˜€ï¸ Uma umuntu oseshayo esondela lapho kufihlwe khona, ofihlile angathi"Uyafudumala!" noma "kuyashisa", uma oseshayo eya ngasohlangothini okungafihliwe kulo, ofihlile angathi "kuyabanda".

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Take turns hiding objects and giving clues - itâ€™s fun for everyone to get involved!
text: ğŸ”„ Shintshanani ngokufihla izinto nokunikana ngomkhondo- kujabulisa wonke umuntu uma bezibandakanya!

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ For an extra challenge, hide multiple objects around the house and create a treasure map.
text: ğŸ’¡ Okwenselelo eyengeziwe, fihlani izinto eziningi ekhaya nakhe imephu yomcebo.

SourceText: This fun-filled game is perfect for challenging problem-solving and communication skills while keeping everyone engaged with exciting clues! âœ¨
text: Lomdlalo ojabulisayo ulungele ukuxazulula izinkinga ezinkulu namakhono okuxoxisana ngenkathi wonke umuntu ezibandakanya ngemikhondo ojabulisayo! âœ¨

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/treasure-hunt
text: Kuguqulelwe kususelwa ku Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/treasure-hunt

SourceText: *Shine a Light*
text: *Khanyisa Ilambu*

SourceText: Let your creativity shine with shadow drawing! Hereâ€™s what youâ€™ll need: pens, paper, and a light â–¶ï¸
text: Yenza ubuhlakani bakho buqhakaze ngomdwebo wesithunzi! Nakhu ozokudinga: amapeni, iphepha, nokukhanya â–¶ï¸

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ Let your child choose an object that they would like to draw - it could be anything from around the house, like a cup or a favourite toy. ğŸ“ Have them place the object upright on a blank sheet of paper.
text: ğŸ‘€ Dedela ingane yakho ikhethe into efisa ukuyidweba - kungaba noma yini ekhona endlini, njengenkomishi noma ithoyizi lakhe eliyintandokaziğŸ“ Yenze iyibeke lento iqonde ephepheni elingabhaliwe.

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ Hold the light behind the object so the shadow appears on the paper. You can take turns holding the light, or rest it on something sturdy to keep your hands free for drawing.
text: ğŸ’¡Khanyisela lento ngelambu ukuze isithunzi sayo sivele ephepheni. Ningashintshana ngokuphatha ilambu elikhanyayo, noma ulibeke entweni enganyakazi ukuze uphumuze izandla khona izandla zizokhululeka ukuze ukwazi ukudweba.

SourceText: ğŸ¨ Now, guide your child so they can trace the shadowâ€™s outline on the paper.
text: ğŸ¨Manje siza ingane yakho ukuze akwazi ukudweba ilandela isithunzi esisephepheni.

SourceText: âœ¨ Once they have finished drawing the shape, itâ€™s time to get creative! Colour and decorate the shadow together to add your own artistic touch.
text: âœ¨ Uma isiqedile ukudweba leyosheyiphu, sekuyisikhathi sokuveza ubuhlakani! Ukufaka umbala nihlobise isithunzi ndawonye ukwengeza ubuchwepheshe.

SourceText: ğŸ“– For extra fun, make up a story about the shadow object together as you decorate. What is it doing today?
text: ğŸ“–Ukuze nijabule ngokwengeziwe, qamba indaba ngesithunzi sento nisahlobisa ndawonye. Yenzani namhlanje?

SourceText: This activity is a fun and imaginative way to boost creativity and flexible thinking while exploring shadows and light ğŸŒˆ
text: Lomsebenzi uyajabulisa futhi uyacabangisa ukugquqguzela ubuciko nokuguqula umcabango ngenkathi nihlola izithunzi nokukhanya ğŸŒˆ

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/shine-a-light
text: Iguqulwe kususelwa ku Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/shine-a-light

SourceText: *Colour Hunt*
text: *Ukuzingela Umbala*

SourceText: Get ready for a colourful adventure that will challenge your childâ€™s thinking and focus ğŸ¨
text: Lungela ukba nohambo olumibalabala okuzokwenza ingane yakho icabange futhi igxile ğŸ¨

SourceText: 5ï¸âƒ£ Gather 5 small objects with different colours (like crayons, building blocks or anything else you have in the house).
text: 5ï¸âƒ£Qoqa izinto ezincane ezinhlanu ezinemibala ehlukene( njengama khrayoni, amabloks okwakha noma yini enye ekhona endlini).

SourceText: ğŸ Place all the coloured objects in a bag. Each participant picks one object from the bag to get started.
text: ğŸ Faka zonke izinto ezinombala esikhwameni. Umuntu ngamunye ukhetha into eyodwa esikhwameni ukuzoqala.

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ Now, the challenge begins! Each player must find three other objects around the house that are the same colour as the object they picked. Search everywhere for the perfect matches!
text: ğŸ‘€ Inselelo iyaqala manje! Umdlali ngamunye kumele athole izinto ezintathu khona endlini ezifanayo ngombala, njengoba bezicoshile lezinto. Sesha yonke indawo ukuthola ezimesha nazo!

SourceText: ğŸš© When a player finds an object that matches the colour, they place it next to the object and shout "match!"
text: Uma umdlali ethola into emesha nombala, bayibeka eduze kwento bamemeze ukuthi "mesh!"

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Once a player has found three matching objects, they can head back to the bag, choose another colour, and start the hunt all over again!
text: ğŸ”„ Uma umdlali esethole izinto ezintathu ezimeshayo, angabuyela esikhwameni, akhethe omunye umbala, aqale azingele futhi!

SourceText: Colour Hunt is a fantastic way to boost focus, encourage problem-solving, and keep everyone moving and engaged. Let the colourful treasure hunt begin! âœ…
text: Ukuzingela umbala indlela enhle yokukhuthaza ukugxila, ukugqugquzela ukusombulula izinkinga nokwenza wonke umuntu anyakaze futhi azibandakanye. Makuqale ukuzingela ubucebi bemibala! âœ…

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/colour-hunt
text: Iguqulwe ku Ukufunda Ngokudlala: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/colour-hunt

SourceText: *Round & Round*
text: *Umjikelezo no Mjikelezo*

SourceText: ğŸ‘‹ Grab each otherâ€™s hands and form a circle.
text: ğŸ‘‹ Bambanani ngezandla nenze isikokela.

SourceText: ğŸµ Walk round and round while you sing a song you know â€“ it could be one from your childhood like â€œRing-a-Rosyâ€ or â€œSawa Sonkeâ€, or a favourite your child loves.
text: ğŸµ Hambani nenze isikokela ngenkathi nicula ingoma eniyaziyo - kungaba enye yangezikhathi nisebanane njengo "Ring-a-Rosy" noma "Sawa Sonke" noma ethandwa ingane yakho.

SourceText: ğŸ‰ As you go round, add some silly moves to make it even more fun. Try hopping on one leg, see if you can put your leg over the next personâ€™s arm, or gently fall to the ground when the song finishes.
text: ğŸ‰ Ngenkathi nizungeza, ningangeza umnyakazo ohlekisayo ukwenzela ukuthi kube nokujabula okwengeziwe. Zamani ukugxuma ngonyawo olulodwa, ubone ukuthi ungakwazi ukubeka umlenze wakho ngaphezu kwengalo yomunye umuntu noma uwele phansi ngokuzolile uma ingoma iphela.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Take turns choosing the next move or song!
text: ğŸ”„ Shintshanani ngokukhetha umnyakazo noma ingoma elandelayo!

SourceText: This activity builds connection, encourages coordination and balance, and sparks lots of laughter and creativity ğŸ˜ƒ
text: Lomsebenzi wakha ukuxhumana, ukugqugquzela ukuxhumanisa nokubhalansisa nokwenza kube nookuhleka nobuhlakani ğŸ˜ƒ

SourceText: *Freeze Like a Statue*
text: *Nqabela njengensika*

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ Let your child shape you into a frozen statue - you might be a tree, a happy, sad or angry person, or anything else they imagine!
text: ğŸ‘€ Dedela ingane yakho ikubumbe njengesithombe esinganyakazi - ungaba isihlahla, ejabulile, dabukisayo noma umuntu othukuthele noma yini enye abayicabangayo!

SourceText: ğŸš© You can even invite others to join and let your child shape you all into a frozen scene, like a classroom, a soccer match, or something completely silly.
text: ğŸš© Ungamema nabanye bajoyine nidedele ingane yakho inibumbe nonke ukuba izithombe ezinganyakazi, njenge kilasi, umdlalo webhola lezinyawo, noma yini ehlekisayo.

SourceText: ğŸ“± Once the statue is ready, your child can be the â€˜photographerâ€™ and take a pretend (or real!) picture.
text: ğŸ“± Uma umfanekiso onganyakazi usulungile, ingane yakho ingaba umthwebuli wezithombe futhi angenza sengathi isithombe sangempela (noma isithombe sangempela!).

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Then swap roles and let them be the statue next.
text: ğŸ”„ Bese nishintshana ngendima umdedele naye abe isithombe esinganyakazi.

SourceText: This activity encourages creativity, role-play, and imagination - while building confidence through leading and observing â­
text: Lomsebenzi ugqugquzela ubuhlakani, ukulingisa nomcabango - ngaleso sikhathi wakha ukuzethemba ngokuhola nokubuka â­

SourceText: *Peg and Pretend*
text: *Wenze sengathi Isikhonkwane*

SourceText: Get creative with easy household items! ğŸ§¸
text: Dala ngezinto zasekhaya! ğŸ§¸

SourceText: ğŸ‘‹ Grab 10 clothing pegs â€“ or more if you have â€“ and build a shape by pegging them together. Let your child build their own creation too!
text: ğŸ‘‹ Thatha amaphegs awu- 10 - noma amaningi uma unawo - nakhe isheyiphu ngokuwahlanganisa. Dedela ingane yakho yakhe okwayo!

SourceText: ğŸ¨ Ask your child what their shape could be. A bug? A spaceship? A crocodile? Act out a little story using the peg creations.
text: ğŸ¨ Buza ingane yakho ukuthi ingab iyiphi isheyiphu yayo. Imbungulu? Umkhumbi? Ingwenya? Lingisa indaba encane usebenzise okwakhiwe ngamaphegs.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Then build something new and let the next story begin!
text: ğŸ”„ Bese nakha into entsha bese niqala indaba entsha!

SourceText: Did you know that these imagination games help your child develop thinking, creativity, fine motor skills, and hand-eye coordination? All from a few simple pegs and a lot of imagination! ğŸ’¡
text: Bewazi ukuthi lemidlalo yemcabango isiza ingane yakho ukuthuthukisa ukucabanga, ubuhlakani, amakhono okuphila, nokuxhumana kwehlo nesandla? Konke lokhu ngenxa yamaphegs nemicabango! ğŸ’¡

SourceText: Adapted from UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yYt2ziDgvRI
text: Iguqulwe kwibhokisi lokudlala lakwa UNICEF: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yYt2ziDgvRI

SourceText: *Wind Power*
text: *Amandla Omoya*

SourceText: Letâ€™s explore the magic of wind with a fun movement game! âœ¨
text: Ake sihlole umlingo womoya ngomdlalo wokunyakaza! âœ¨

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ First, talk with your child about the wind. Can you see it? Taste it? How does it feel on your hair or your skin?
text: ğŸ‘€ Qala, ngokukhuluma nengane yakho ngomoya. Uyawubona? Uwunambithe? Uzwakala kanjani ezinweleni noma esikhumbeni?

SourceText: ğŸ”¶ Take a piece of card or a leaf, close your eyes, and blow it using your own wind power. Watch how it moves!
text: ğŸ”¶ Thatha isqephu sekhadi noma ihlamvu. vala amehlo, futhi uwuphephethe usebenzise awakho amandla omoya. Buka ukuthi unyakaza kanjani!

SourceText: ğŸ”µ Now try heavier things. Can you blow a spoon or small stones? Whatâ€™s different?
text: ğŸ”µ Zama izinto ezisindayo. Ungakwazi ukuphephetha isipuni noma amatshe amancane? Yini ehlukile?

SourceText: ğŸ¨ Time to play with water and wind! Drop small amounts of water on a plate or piece of plastic. Blow the water gently across the surface - you can make a straw to blow through by rolling up a small piece of paper.
text: ğŸ¨ Isikhathi sokudlala ngamanzi nomoya! Chitha amanzi amancane epuleyitini noma kupulastiki. Phephethela amanzi phansi - ungazenzela istro ngokugoqa iphepha uphephethe ngaso.

SourceText: ğŸ† You can even place objects and try blowing the water around them to trace their shape.
text: ğŸ†Ungabeka izinto uzame ukuphephetha amanzi ezizungezile ukulandela isheyiphi yazo.

SourceText: This sensory activity helps your child understand movement, space, and airflow - while sparking creativity and laughter ğŸ’¡
text: Lomsebenzi wemizwa usiza ingane yakho ukuthi iqonde umnyakazo, indawo nokungena komoya - ngesikhathi evusa ubuhlakani futhi ehleka ğŸ’¡

SourceText: Adapted from UNICEF Playbox: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=COZu4eJltow
text: Iguqulwe kwibhokisi lokudlala lakwa UNICEF: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=COZu4eJltow

SourceText: *Blanket Forts*
text: *Indawo Ethokomele*

SourceText: Letâ€™s dive into creating your very own cosy hideaway! ğŸ§¸
text: Masiqale ukwakha indawo yakho yokucasha ethokomele! ğŸ§¸

SourceText: ğŸ‘‹ First, gather everything youâ€™ll need - blankets, pillows, chairs, and maybe even a table. If you want to add a little magic, grab a light to light up your fort.
text: ğŸ‘‹ Qala ngokuqoqa konke ozokudinga - ingubo yokulala, imicamelo, izihlalo mhlawumbe netafula. Uma ufuna ukungeza umlingo, thatha ilambu ukukhanyisa indawo yokuthokomala.

SourceText: ğŸ”· Now, itâ€™s time to build. Start by setting up two chairs facing each other, or use a table as the main structure of your fort.
text: ğŸ”·Manje isikhathi sokwakha. Qala ngokusetha izihlalo ezimbili uzibeke zibhekane noma usebenzise itafula njengesisekelo sendawo ethokomele.

SourceText: ğŸ‘‹ Drape the blankets over the chairs or table to create a roof. Donâ€™t forget to secure them - use clothing pegs or something heavy to hold everything in place so your fort stays strong!
text: ğŸ‘‹Ndlala izingubo phezu kwezihlalo noma itafula ukwakha uphahla. Ungakhohlwa ukuthi ziphephe - sebenzisa amapegs ezimpahla noma into esindayo ukuze kubambeke ziqine!

SourceText: ğŸ”´ Next, make the inside extra comfy with pillows or blankets.
text: ğŸ”´Yenza ingaphakathi libe ntofontofo ngemicamelo noma izingubo zokulala.

SourceText: ğŸˆ Once your fort is built, add some fun touches. Ask your child to bring their favourite toys or books, and decorate the space however you like.
text: ğŸˆUma indawo yokuthokomala isiyakhiwe, nezezela okujabulisayo okokugcina. Cela ingane yakho ilethe amathoyizi nezincwadi ezithandayo nihlobise leyondawo ngendlela enithanda ngayo.

SourceText: ğŸ“ You could even make a â€œwelcomeâ€ sign together to make it feel like your very own special house!
text: ğŸ“ Ningenza ngisho umbhalo "wamukelekile" ndawonye ukuze kuzwakale njengendlu yenu ebalulekile!

SourceText: ğŸŒ™ Now, crawl inside and enjoy your new fort! This is your cosy, creative space for reading stories, playing games, or just spending some quiet time together.
text: ğŸŒ™ Ungakhasa ngaphakathi ujabulele indawo yokuthokomala entsha! Le indawo ethokomele, indawo yobuhlakani yokufunda izindaba, ukudlala imidlalo noma indawo yokuchitha isikhathi esinokuthula ndawonye.

SourceText: Building a blanket fort is more than just a fun activity - itâ€™s a chance to spark creativity, solve problems, and share special moments together. So, grab those blankets and start building your adventure today! ğŸ’¡
text: Ukwakha indawo ngengubo yokulala kungaphezu komsebenzi ojabulisayo - isikhathi sokukhuthaza ubuhlakani, ukuxazulula izinkinga, nokuchitha isikhathi esibalulekile ndawonye nokuqala ukwakha uhambo namhlanje! ğŸ’¡

SourceText: *Tricky Tower*
text: *Umbhoshongo Okhohlisayo*

SourceText: Here is an exciting activity that will test your childâ€™s ability to estimate risks, work as a team, and think creatively - all while having fun and developing fine motor skills â­
text: Nawu umsebenzi ojabulisayo ozohlola ikhono lengane yakho lokuhlola ingozi, ukusebenzisana, nokucabanga ngobuhlakani - ngesikhathi ijabule nokuthuthukisa amakhono okuphila â­

SourceText: ğŸ”¶ Start by giving your child building blocks or something else they can stack.
text: ğŸ”¶ Qala ngokunika ingane yakho izitini zokwakha noma enye into abangenza ngayo isitaki.

SourceText: ğŸ‘‹ Ask them to build a tower by stacking the blocks, using just one hand. This challenge helps build focus and concentration as they balance the blocks carefully.
text: ğŸ‘‹ Yicele ukuthiy akhe umbhoshongo ngokutaka izitini, esebenzisa isandla esisodwa. Lenselelo isiza ukwakha ukugxila njengoba ibhalansisa izitini ngokucophelela.

SourceText: â¬†ï¸ If other children or adults are around, you can make it into a match to see who can build the tallest tower the fastest.
text: â¬†ï¸ Uma kukhona ezinye izingane noma abantu abadala eduzane, ungayenza kube umncintiswano ukubona ukuthi ngubani ongakha umbhoshongo omude kuneminye ngokushesha.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Make the game even more challenging by asking your child to using their non-dominant hand. Theyâ€™ll have to balance their wish to build the tallest tower with the risk of the tower collapsing.
text: ğŸ”„ Yenza umdlalo ube nzinyana ngokuthi ucele ingane yakho ukuthi isebenzise isandla esingenawo amandla. Kumele ibhalansise isifiso sokwakha umbhoshongo omude kunobungozi bokuthi ungawa umbhoshongo.

SourceText: This isnâ€™t just about building - itâ€™s about problem-solving, persistence, and teamwork ğŸ’›
text: Lokhu akukhona ngokwakha nje - kungokuxazulula inkinga, ukuphikelela, nokusebenzisana ğŸ’›

SourceText: Tricky Tower is a fantastic way to help your child develop important skills while having fun with friends or family ğŸ†
text: Umbhoshongo okhohlisayo indlela enhle kakhulu ukusiza ingane yakho ukuthuthukisa amakhono abalulekile ngesikhathi ijabula nabangani noma umndeni ğŸ†

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/tricky-tower
text: Iguqulwe kususwa ku Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/tricky-tower

SourceText: *Flip the blanket*
text: *Phendula ingubo*

SourceText: Can you and your child flip a blanket while standing on it? ğŸš©
text: Ungakwazi wena nengane yakho ukuphendula ingubo ngesikhathi nimi phezu kwayo ğŸš©

SourceText: â¬‡ï¸ Start by laying a blanket or large piece of cloth flat on the ground. Have all the players stand on the blanket - make sure no one steps off!
text: â¬‡ï¸ Qala ngokubeka ingubo yokulala phezu kwendwangu phansi. Abadlali bonke bame phezu kwengubo - wenze isiqiniseko sokuthi akekho onyathela eceleni!

SourceText: ğŸ‘‹ Now, the challenge begins. The players must work together to flip the blanket over without stepping off or touching the ground.
text: ğŸ‘‹ Inselelo iyaqala manje. Abadlali kumele basebenzisane ukuphendula ingubo ngaphandle kokunyathela eceleni noma ukuthinta phansi.

SourceText: ğŸ”‘ Experiment with different ideas, try new strategies, and see what works best!
text: ğŸ”‘ Zama imibono ehlukene, zama amaqhinga amasha, ubone ukuthi ikuphi okusebenza kangcono!

SourceText: ğŸ”„ If anyone touches the ground, no worries - just start over and give it another try.
text: ğŸ”„ Uma kukhona othinta phansi, ayikho inkinga - qala phansi uzame futhi.

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ While you are playing, talk about the problem-solving you are doing. Ask the players what ideas they are trying and why, how they are working together, and what is working and what is not. Discuss how they came up with solutions as a team.
text: ğŸ‘€ Ngesikhathi udlala, khuluma ngokuxazulula inkinga lokhu okwenzayo. Buza abadlali ukuthi iyiphi imibono abayizamayo nokuthi kungobani, basebenzisana kanjani ndawonye. ikuphi okusebenzayo nokuthi ikuphi okungasebenzi. Xoxani ngokuthi baqhamuke kanjani nesisombululo njengeqembu.

SourceText: Flip the Blanket is a fantastic way to encourage teamwork, creative thinking, problem solving, and perseverance - all while having a great time together! ğŸ‰
text: Ukuphendula ingubo indlea enhle kakhulu yokugqugquzela ukusebenzisana, ukucabanga ngobuhlakani, ukusombulula inkinga nokubekezela - konke ngesikhathi bedlala umdlalo omuhle kakhulu ndawonye! ğŸ‰

SourceText: Adapted from Learning Through Play: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/flip-the-blanket
text: Iguqulwe ku Ukufunda Ngokudlala: https://learningthroughplay.com/let-s-play/flip-the-blanket

SourceText: *Can You Catch It?*
text: *Ungayibamba?*

SourceText: Letâ€™s see if you can follow instructions while catching a ball! âš½
text: Ake sibone ukuthi ungayilandela imiyalelo ngesikhathi ubamba ibhola! âš½

SourceText: âœ… Start by standing about three metres apart and gently throw a ball at each other. After a few easy throws, itâ€™s time to introduce the rules!
text: âœ… Qalani ngokuma niqhelelane amamitha amathathu bese niphoselana ibhola ngobumnene. Ngemuva kokuphoselana kalula, manje isikhathi sokwethula imithetho!

SourceText: 1ï¸âƒ£ When the thrower shouts â€˜oneâ€™, the catcher has to catch the ball with their right hand and put their left foot out.
text: 1ï¸âƒ£ Uma ophonsayo ememeza ethi 'one' onqakayo kumele anqake ibhola ngesandla sokudla abeke unyawo lwakhe lwesinxele ngaphandle.

SourceText: 2ï¸âƒ£ If the thrower shouts â€˜twoâ€™, the catcher catches with their left hand and puts their right foot out.
text: 2ï¸âƒ£ Uma ophonsayo ememeza ethi 'thu' onqakayo kumele anqake ibhola ngesandla sesinxele abeke unyawo lwakhe lwesokudla ngaphandle.

SourceText: â­ Once youâ€™re confident, add some extra numbers and rules!
text: â­ Uma usuzethemba, ungangeza ezinye izinamba neminye imithetho!

SourceText: â° For the game to work, make sure the number is called before you throw the ball, so the catcher has time to react!

SourceText: ğŸ‘‚ Once everything is in the box, discuss what you and your child chose. Ask them why these things make them happy. Itâ€™s a great way to get them talking about positive emotions.
text: ğŸ‘‚ Uma yonke into isisebhokisini khuluma ukuthi nikhethani nengane yakho. Yibuze ukuthi kungani lezinto ziyijabulisa. Indlela enhle yokubenza bakhulume ngemizwa emihle.

SourceText: You can play this game as often as you like - even daily! Doing this before bed can help your child stay motivated, happy, and calm, especially during tough times.

SourceText: So, gather those happy things and create a special box full of joy! â­
text: Qoqa lezo zinto ezijabulisayo futhi wakhe ibhokisi eligcwele intokozo! â­

SourceText: *Secret Handshake*

text: ğŸ’› Uma usuwenza kahle umnyakazo wenu, yenzani ukuxhawula okuyimfihlo kube ingxenye yesejwayelo sakho. Isebenzise njengendlela ejabulisayo yokubingelela ngemuva kokuphuma kwesikole, noma inini uma ufuna umuzwa obalulekile wokuxhumana.

SourceText: ğŸ¨ All you need to play this game is a piece of paper and a pen or pencil.

SourceText: 1ï¸âƒ£ The first person draws the top (head, hat, hair) of a character. This can be as serious or silly as you want it to be.

text: 2ï¸âƒ£ Dlulisela iphepha kumuntu olandelayo, ongabonanga ukuthi sekudwetshwe ini, azonezezela kokulandelayo kumlingisi: Amahlombe noma isisu. Goqa iphepha ukuze umboze osekudwetshiwe bese uyalidlulisa.
