SourceText: *Check-in chat*
text: *Ingoxo yokubuza impilo*

SourceText: Actively checking in on one another helps to keep relationships healthy! â­
text: Ukuqhubeka nibhekana kuyasiza ukuthi nigcine ubudlelwano bunempilo! â­

SourceText: Ask each other questions: â€œWhat made you happy today?â€ ğŸ‘‚ â€œWhat was difficult today?â€ ğŸ‘‚ â€œHow can I help you?â€ ğŸ‘‚
text: Buzanani imibuzo: "Yini ekwenze wajabula namhlanje?" ğŸ‘‚ "Yini ebeyinzima namhlanje?" ğŸ‘‚ "Ngingakusiza kanjani? ğŸ‘‚

SourceText: For this to help, your teen needs to feel safe while sharing things with you. Be open to their responses. ğŸ’š Teens tend to be more honest when they trust that what they say will not be used against them later.
text: Ukuze lokhu kusize, umntwana wakho osemusha udinga ukuzizwa ephephile ngenkathi ukutshela izinto. Zivule ukuzwa izimpendulo wakhe. ğŸ’š Intsha ijwayele ukuba neqiniso kakhulu uma bethemba ukuthi abazokusho angeke kusentshiswe ukubalimaza kamuva.

SourceText: Go easy on yourself if your teen does not want to share their problems with you. ğŸ’™ Often, teens are afraid to share as they are scared they will get in trouble. Getting upset with them wonâ€™t help - keep showing you love them and give them time! ğŸŒ·
text: Zikhululekele uma ingane yakho ingafuni ukwabelana nawe ngezinkinga zayo. ğŸ’™ Ngokuvamile, ingane iyesaba ukwabelana njengoba yesaba ukuthi izongena enkingeni. Ukucasuka ngabo ngeke kusize - qhubeka ubabonisa ukuthi uyabathanda futhi ubanike isikhathi! ğŸŒ·

SourceText: *Express Yourself*
text: *Zichaze*

SourceText: Dancing makes people happy!
text: Ukudansa kwenza abantu bajabule!

SourceText: ğŸŒˆ This game can be played in pairs or as a group - stand facing each other or in a circle.
text: ğŸŒˆ Lo mdlalo ungadlalwa nibabili noma eqenjini - ima nibhekane noma endingilizini.

SourceText: ğŸµ Together, choose a fun and upbeat song to play and a person to start the game by creating one dance move.
text: ğŸµ Ndawonye, khethani ingoma emnandi enokujabula idlale bese umuntu aqale umdlalo ngokuthi adale umdanso owodwa.

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ The person to their right must copy that dance move and add their own move to it.
text: ğŸ‘€ Umuntu ongasesandleni sokudla kufanele akopishe lowo mdanso bese efaka umdanso wakhe.

SourceText: âœ¨ Go around the circle, each person adding their own dance move to the full song.
text: âœ¨ Jikelezani endingilizini, umuntu nomuntu afake umdanso wakhe engomeni ephelele.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ The first one who forgets someone's dance moves or does it in the wrong order chooses the next song and starts the game again.
text: ğŸ”„ Owokuqala okhohlwayo umdanso womunye umuntu noma oyenza nge-oda engalungile ukhetha ingoma elilandelayo bese uqala umdlalo futhi.

SourceText: ğŸ‰ Try new dance moves with this game and have fun!
text: ğŸ‰ Zama ukunyakaza komdanso omusha ngalo mdlalo futhi ujabule!

SourceText: *2 Truths, 1 Lie*
text: *Amaqiniso amabili, Amanga awodwa*

SourceText: This is a fun, quick game, and the point of it is to learn things about each other. Make your answers as interesting as possible! ğŸ¨
text: Lona umdlalo ojabulisayo, osheshayo, futhi inhloso yawo wukufunda izinto ngomunye nomunye. Yenza izimpendulo zakho zibe mnandi ngangokunokwenzeka! ğŸ¨

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ Think of 3 facts about yourself. 2 must be true, 1 must be a lie.
text: ğŸ’¡ Cabanga amaqiniso awu- 3 ngawe. Kufanele okubili kube iqiniso, okukodwa kube amanga.

SourceText: ğŸ”· Here are some examples: I hate bananas, I have travelled to Kenya, my favourite subject in school was maths.
text: ğŸ”· Nazi izibonelo: Ngiyawuzonda ubhanana, ngake ngaya eKhenya, isifundo sami ebengisithanda esikolweni bekuyizibalo.

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ Share the facts with your teen and ask them to guess which one is a lie.
text: ğŸ‘€ Yethula amaqiniso kumfana noma intombazane yakho futhi ubabuze baqagele ukuthi iyiphi engamanga.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Now ask them to do the same, and guess theirs.
text: ğŸ”„ Manje bacele ukuthi benze okufanayo, bese uqagela okwabo.

SourceText: Did you learn anything new about your teen, or did they learn anything new about you? ğŸ’›
text: Ingabe kukhona okusha okufundile mayelana nomntwana wakho, noma kukhona okusha umntwana akufundile ngawe? ğŸ’›

SourceText: *Yes, No or Maybe*
text: *Yebo, Cha noma Mhlawumbe*

SourceText: Are you tired of hearing your teen say yes, no, or maybe to all of your questions? Turn your chat into a game, and donâ€™t allow one-word answers. ğŸˆ
text: Ingabe ukhathele ukuzwa ingane yakho ithi yebo, cha, noma mhlawumbe kuyo yonke imibuzo yakho? Shintsha ingxoxo yakho ibe umdlalo, futhi ungamvumeli ukuthi aphendule ngegama elilodwa. ğŸˆ

SourceText: ğŸ”´ Teens are known to give one-word answers to avoid talking.
text: ğŸ”´ Intsha yaziwa ngokuphendula ngegama elilodwa ukugwema ukukhuluma.

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ When you would like to really know how your teen is doing, you can turn your chat into a game.
text: ğŸ’¡ Ungafisa ukwazi nini ukuthi umfana noma intombazane yakho unjani, ungashintsha ingxoxo yenu ibe ngumdlalo.

SourceText: â­ Take turns asking each other questions. The only rule is that you cannot use one-word responses, such as Yes, No, Maybe, Fine, and Okay.
text: â­ Shintshisanani nibuzana imibuzo. Umthetho owodwa ukuthi anikwazi ukuphendula ngegama elilodwa, njengo Yebo, Cha, Mhlawumbe, Kahle, futhi Kulungile.

SourceText: âš½ You can ask about things your teen likes or what they did today. For example, how was your day? What are you excited for? Is there anything worrying you?
text: âš½ Ungayibuza ngezinto ezithandayo nokuthi enyzeni namhlanje ingane yakho. Isibonelo, belunjani usuku lwakho? Yini oyijabulele? Ngabe kukhona okukukhathazayo?

SourceText: ğŸ”„ It is important to let your teen ask a question as well. Trust is built when your teen can see that you are also sharing your life with them, and not only trying to learn about their life.
text: ğŸ”„ Kubalulekile ukuthi uvumele ingane yakho nayo ibuze umbuzo. Ukwethembana kwakheka lapho ingane yakho ibona ukuthi nawe wabelana nayo ngempilo yakho, awugcini ngokuzama ukufunda ngempilo yayo.

SourceText: *Movie World*
text: *Umhlaba Wefilimu*

SourceText: Leaving the busy and stressful world behind can be good for our health. ğŸŒ± Take a moment to escape with your teen by creating a superhero story together!
text: Ukushiya umhlaba ophithizelayo nokhathazanayo ngemuva kungaba yinto enhle ekuphileni kwethu. ğŸŒ± Thatha umzuzu ube nomntwana wakho niqambe indaba engeqhawe ndawonye!

SourceText: ğŸˆ Ask your teen to imagine that they are a superhero and what their superpowers would be. Flying? Time travel? Mind reading? Super Strength?
text: ğŸˆ Cela ingane yakho yakho ukuthi icabange ukuthi uyiqhawe nokuthi amandla akhe angaba yini. Ukundiza? Ukubuyela emuva esikhathini? Ukufunda umqondo? Amandla Amakhulu?

SourceText: âœ¨ Ask them how they would use these superpowers, and why.
text: âœ¨ Yibuze ukuthi ingawasebenzisa kanjani amandla ayo, futhi kungani.

SourceText: ğŸŒˆ Help them give their superhero a name, an outfit, and a sidekick, and act it out. If your teen does not want to act, that is fine - talking about it is just as good!
text: ğŸŒˆ Siza ukuthi iqambe iqhawe layo igama, izingubo zokugqoka, nomngani wakhe bese niyalingisa. Uma ingane yakho ingafuni ukulingisa, kulungile - ukukhuluma ngakho kwanele!

SourceText: ğŸ‘‘ Now, let them make up a superhero for you. Play the part! You can ask questions, like who the villain would be, or how you became a superhero.
text: ğŸ‘‘ Manje, badedele bakwakhele iqhawe. Lingisa! Ungabuza imibuzo, njengokuthi isitha kungaba ngubani, noma ube yiqhawe kanjani.

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ Create a story - what happens to the characters? Is it an action story? Is it a thriller, space, sport, adventure, or romance?
text: ğŸ’¡ Dala indaba - kwenzekani kubalingiswa? Indaba eyokulwa? Indaba egijimisa igazi, umkhathi, ezimidlalo, indaba eyohambo, noma ezothando?

SourceText: â¡ï¸ Next time you play this game, you could create a new story or superhero with your teen or continue the story you started together.
text: â¡ï¸ Ngokuzayo uma udlala lo mdlalo, ungaqamba indaba entsha noma engeqhawe elinamandla nomntwana wakho noma niqhubeke nendaba eniyiqale ndawonye.

SourceText: Exercise is a great way to spend time together and it is so good for your health. ğŸŒ± Find a sport or exercise that both you and your teen want to do and try it out together!
text: Ukuzivocavoca indlela enhle yokuchitha isikhathi ndawonye futhi kulungele ukuphila kwenu. ğŸŒ± Thola umdlalo noma indlela yokuzivocavoca wena nomntwana wakho bese niyazama ndawonye!

SourceText: âš½ Together you can walk, run, play soccer, swim, dance, or do any other sport..
text: âš½ Ndawonye ningahamba, nigijime, nidlale ibhola, nibhukude, nidanse, noma nenze omunye umdlalo..

SourceText: ğŸ”„ If you or your teen do not like the first exercise you pick, try a new exercise.
text: ğŸ”„ Uma wena noma umfana noma intombazane yakho esanda kweva eshumini nambili ningawuthandi umsebenzi wokuqala owukhethayo, zama umsebenzi omusha.

SourceText: *Make up a story*
text: *Qamba inganekwane*

SourceText: Creating stories together is a great way to learn the art of storytelling - and to build your teenâ€™s creativity! ğŸ“–
text: Ukudala izindaba ndawonye indlela enhle yokufunda ubuciko bokuxoxa izindaba - futhi kwakha ikhono lokudala kumfana noma intombazane yakho wakho! ğŸ“–

SourceText: ğŸ”Ÿ With your teen, come up with 10 words to use. They can be any words you want! For example: banana, spaceship, fish, water, painting, wasp nest, cooking, wedding.
text: ğŸ”Ÿ Cabangani amagama awu- 10 ninomntwana wakho eningawasebenzisa. Kungaba inoma imaphi amagama eniwafunayo! Isibonelo: ubhanana, umkhumbi wasemkhathini, inhlanzi, amanzi, ukupenda, isidleke somnyovu, ukupheka, umshado.

SourceText: ğŸ‚ Start your story with, â€œOnce upon a time, there was aâ€¦â€ and make sure you use one of the words from the list in your sentence. For example, â€œOnce upon a time, there was a family who worked on a *banana* farm.â€
text: ğŸ‚ Qala indaba yakho ngokuthi, "Kwasukasukela, kwakukhona i..." bese uqiniseka ukuthi usebenzisa elilodwa lamagama kuhlu lwakho. Isibonelo, "Kwasukasukela, kwakukhona umndeni owawusebenza efamini *labhanana*."

SourceText: ğŸ“ Let your teen make up the next sentence using another word from the list.
text: ğŸ“ Vumela ingane yakho ukuthi icabange umusho olandelayo ngokusebenzisa elinye igama kuhlu lwamagama eniwacabangile.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Take turns until you have used as many words from the list as you can, or until you have finished your story.
text: ğŸ”„ Shintshisanani nize nisebenzise wonke amagama kuhlu eningawa sebenzisa, noma nize niqede indaba yenu.

SourceText: ğŸ”” Be as creative as possible with your story and do not tell your teen what to say. It does not need to be a real story to be a good story!
text: ğŸ”” Yiba nobuciko kangangokho onakho ngale ndaba yakho futhi ungamtsheli ingani ukuthi athini amagama ewacabangile. Akudingeki ukuthi kuze kube indaba yangempela ukuze kube indaba enhle!

SourceText: ğŸ Ask your teen what their favourite part of the story was, and tell them yours!
text: ğŸ Buza ingane yakho ukuthi iyiphi ingxenye ayithanda kakhulu endabeni, bese uyitshela eyakho!

SourceText: *Take A Pause with your teen*
text: *Thatha Ikhefu nomntwana wakho*

SourceText: Take a pause with your teen. This helps them deal with stress in a healthy way!
text: Thatha ikhefu nomntwana wakho. Lokhu kubasiza ukubhekana nokukhathazeka ngendlela enempilo!

SourceText: â° You could take a pause before dinner, after school, before school, or before bedtime.
text: â° Ningathatha ikhefu ngaphambi kwesidlo sasebusuku, emva kwesikole, ngaphambi kwesikole, noma ngaphambi kwesikhathi sokulala.

SourceText: ğŸ‘‚ Sit down together and close your eyes. Listen to your breath as it goes in and out. Notice how you feel.
text: ğŸ‘‚ Hlalani ndawonye bese nivala amehlo. Lalela umphefumulo kwakho uma uphuma ungena. Bheka ukuthi uzizwa kanjani.

SourceText: â­ Take 5 more deep breaths.
text: â­ Phefumula kakhulu kawu-5.

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ When you are ready, open your eyes again. Do you feel any different?
text: ğŸ‘€ Uma usulungile, vala amehlo akho futhi. Uyawuzwa umehluko?

SourceText: â¸ Ask your teen what it was like to take a pause. Listen and accept whatever they say about it.
text: â¸ Buza ingane yakho ukuthi bekunjani ukuthatha ikhefu. Lalela futhi wamukele noma yini ayishoyo ngakho.

SourceText: *Name That Tune*
text: *Qamba leloculo*

SourceText: Listening to music is a great way to lower your stress and have fun with your family. ğŸ’š
text: Ukulalela umculo indlela enhle yokwehlisa ukukhathazeka nokuzijabulisa nomndeni wakho. ğŸ’š

SourceText: ğŸ“» Gather your family members and choose one person to play, sing or hum a song.
text: ğŸ“» Qoqa amalunga omndeni wakho bese ukhetha umuntu oyedwa ukuthi adlale ingoma noma acule.

SourceText: â“ Everyone else must guess the name and artist of the song.
text: â“ Bonke abanye abantu kufanele baqagele igama nomculi wengoma.

SourceText: ğŸ‰ The first one to guess it right becomes the next person to sing or play a song.
text: ğŸ‰ Owokuqala oqagela kahle kuba nguyena umuntu olandelayo oculayo noma odlala ingoma.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Keep going around until everyone has been able to play their favourite song and let the rest hear.
text: ğŸ”„ Qhubekani nijikeleza kuze kube yilapho wonke umuntu esekwazi ukudlala ingoma yakhe eyintandokazi futhi aqiniseke ukuthi abanye bayezwa.

SourceText: *Pass the ball*
text: *Dlulisa ibhola*

SourceText: â¡ï¸ Start in a circle and pass the ball around.
text: â¡ï¸ Qala endlingilizini bese udlulisa ibhola.

SourceText: *Make Housework Fun*
text: *Yenza Umsebenzi Wasendlini Ujabulise*

SourceText: Turn your chores into games! ğŸ†
text: Shintsha imisebenzi yasekhaya kube imidlalo! ğŸ†

SourceText: â˜€ï¸ Making housework fun is a good way to teach your teen to be responsible and to rely on themselves.
text: â˜€ï¸ Ukwenza umsebenzi wasendlini ujabulise indlela enhle yokufundisa umfana noma intombazane yakho ukuzimela.

SourceText: ğŸ“ Together, make a list of all the chores that must be done in your home.
text: ğŸ“ Ndawonye, yenza uhlu lwayo yonke imisebenzi yasekhaya okufanele yenziwe.

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ Make sure the tasks are fair and things your teen can do. For example, washing up, sweeping, mopping, making the beds, and laundry.
text: ğŸ’¡ Qiniseka ukuthi imisebenzi ilungile futhi imisebenzi umfana noma intombazane yakho angayenza. Isibonelo, ukuwasha, ukushanela, ukukorobha, ukwendlula umbhede, nokuwasha izimpahla.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Each week, let a different person in the family choose a chore first.
text: ğŸ”„ Njalo ngesonto, dedela umuntu ohlukile emndenini ukuthi akhethe umsebenzi wasekhaya kuqala.

SourceText: ğŸµ Play some music or turn on the radio. Music is a great way to make a boring task fun!
text: ğŸµ Dlala umculo noma ukhanyise umsakazo. Umculo indlela enhle ukwenza umsebenzi obhorayo ube mnandi!

SourceText: âœ… Tick off the tasks when they are done so you can see your progress as a family. You could offer small rewards as motivation to complete activities.
text: âœ… Thikha uma umsebenzi wenziwe ukuze nibone inthuthuko yenu njengomndeni. Ungabeka umklomelo omncane njengogqozi lokuqeda umsebenzi.

SourceText: ğŸ“º For example, you could let your teen watch more TV, spend more time with their friends, choose what they want for dinner, or have something sweet if they do their chores in a fair amount of time.
text: ğŸ“º Isibonelo, ungavumela umntwana wakho abukele iTV, achithe isikhathi nabangani bakhe, akhethe ukuthi kungaba isiphi isidlo sasebusuku, noma athole okunoshukela uma enza umsebenzi wakhe wasekhaya ngesikhathi esifanele.

SourceText: â“ If your child does not complete a chore, ask them why, and come up with a fair consequence together.
text: â“ Uma ingane yakho ingawuqedi umsebenzi othile, yibuze ukuthi kungani, bese niqhamuka nomphumela omuhle ndawonye.

SourceText: *Iâ€™m Going on a Picnic and I Will Bringâ€¦*
text: *Ngiya kwipikiniki futhi Ngizophathaâ€¦*

SourceText: Memory games are a fun way to strengthen our brains!
text: Imidlalo yenkumbulo indlela ejabulisayo yokuqinisa izingqondo zethu!

SourceText: ğŸ‚ Think of all the things you would have at your dream picnic.
text: ğŸ‚ Cabanga zonke izinto ongabanazo kwipikiniki yamaphupho akho.

SourceText: ğŸˆ The first person says, â€œOn Saturday, I am going to the park to have a picnic. To this picnic, I will bring...â€ and they say one thing they will bring to the picnic.
text: ğŸˆ Umuntu wokuqala uthi, "NgoMqibelo, ngiya epaki ngiyoba nepikiniki. Kule pikiniki, ngizoletha..." bese esho okukodwa azokuletha kupikiniki.

SourceText: ğŸ… For example: a sandwich, a ball, a blanket, forks, cups, a dog, or coca cola.
text: ğŸ… Isibonelo: isemishi, ibhola ingubo, izimfoloko, izinkomishi, inja, noma i-coca cola.

SourceText: ğŸ”” The second person adds to the first person's list, but must start at the beginning: â€œOn Saturday, I am going to the park to have a picnic. To this picnic, I will bring...â€ and say the item that the first person said AND then add their own item to the list.
text: ğŸ”” Umuntu wesibili wengeza kuhlu lomuntu wokuqala, kodwa kufanele aqale ekuqaleni: "NgoMgqibelo, ngiya epaki ngiyoba nepikiniki. Kule pikiniki, ngizoletha..." bese esho into eshiwo ngumuntu wokuqala BESE efaka nento yakhe lapho.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Each time you add an item, you must say all previous items first - in the correct order!
text: ğŸ”„ Njalo mawufaka into, kefanele usho zonke izinto esezishiwo kuqala - zilandelana kahle!

SourceText: â­ Each person adds to the list, while remembering all the previous items.
text: â­ Umuntu ngamunye uyafaka kuhlu, abe ekhumbula izinto esezishiwo ngaphambili.

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ If everyone has a turn, keep going and building your list. The first person to forget an item restarts the game!
text: ğŸ‘€ Uma wonke umuntu enethuba, qhubeka futhi wakhe uhlu lwakho. Umuntu wokuqala okhohlwa into ethile uqala kabusha umdlalo!

SourceText: *This is who I am*
text: *Yilokhu engiyikho*

SourceText: Self-esteem is the way you value yourself, either in a positive or negative way. Helping your teen to have high self-esteem is a recipe for success! ğŸ†
text: Ukuzethemba yindlela ozazisa ngayo, ngendlela enhle noma embi. Ukusiza umtwana wakho umfana noma intombazane yakho ukuba azethembe kuyindlela yempumelelo! ğŸ†

SourceText: â­Share with your teen 3 things you like about yourself!
text: â­ Yabelana numfana noma intombazane yakho wakho izinto ezi-3 ozithandayo ngawe!

SourceText: 3ï¸âƒ£ Ask your teen to tell you 3 things they like about themselves.
text: 3ï¸âƒ£ Cela umtwana wakho umfana noma intombazane yakho ukuthi akutshele izinto ezintathu-3 azithandayo ngaye.

SourceText: For example: I am great at treating others kindly. I am great at styling my hair. I am great at football. âš½
text: Isibonelo: Ngimuhle ekuphatheni abantu ngomusa. Ngimuhle ukwenzeni izinwele zami. Ngimuhle ekudlaleni kwebhola. âš½

SourceText: If your teen does not feel comfortable sharing these, ask them to write them down. ğŸ“
text: Uma ingane yakho ingazizwa ikhululekile ukwabelana ngalokhu, yicele ukuthi ikubhale phansi. ğŸ“

SourceText: *Things I like about others and me*
text: *Izinto engizithanda ngami nangabanye*

SourceText: Here is an activity to help you and your teen notice the good parts of themselves.
text: Nawu umsebenzi ozosiza wena nengane yakho ukuze niqaphele izinto ezinhle ngani.

SourceText: â˜€ï¸Ask your teen to share 3 things they like about a friend or someone they admire, like a celebrity.
text: â˜€ï¸ Cela umtwana wakho ukuthi akutshele izinto eziwu- 3 azithandayo ngomngani noma umuntu amkhonzile, njengosaziwayo.

SourceText: â“ Ask them if they share any of these qualities, too.
text: â“ Babuze uma benazo nabo lezimfanelo ezifanayo.

SourceText: ğŸ’™ You can do the same: share with your teen the qualities you like about yourself or about someone you admire - and what you like about your teen!
text: ğŸ’™ Ungenza okufanayo: yabelana nomntwana wakho ngezimfanelo ozithandayo ngawe noma ngothile omthandayo - nalokho okuthandayo ngengane yakho!

SourceText: *Make a family wish list*
text: *Yenza uhlu lwezifiso zomndeni*

SourceText: Wish lists are a great way to set, plan and keep track of your goals and dreams. ğŸŒ·
text: Uhlu lwezifiso indlela enhle yokuhlela nokulandelela izifiso namaphupho akho. ğŸŒ·

SourceText: ğŸ“ To start your wish list, gather your family together and grab pens and paper.
text: ğŸ“ Ukuqala uhlu lwakho lwezifiso, hlanganisa umndeni wakho ndawonye bese nithola amapeni namaphepha.

SourceText: ğŸš² Allow each family member to write a list of goals and experiences they want to achieve this year.
text: ğŸš² Vumela amalunga omndeni abhale uhlu lwezifiso kanye nezinto abafisa zifezeke kulo nyaka.

SourceText: ğŸ‚ For example: exercise daily, read 1 book a month, make a new friend, learn to bake a cake, learn to juggle, or go watch the local soccer team play.
text: ğŸ‚ Isibonelo: ukuzivocavoca nsuku zonke, funda incwadi eyodwa ngenyanga, ukwenza umngani omusha, funda ukubhaka ikhekhe, funda ukuphonsa amabhola emoyeni uwabambe, noma hamba uyobheka iqembu lebhola lasendaweni lidlala.

SourceText: ğŸ”” Once you have finished, put the list up where everyone can see it daily.
text: ğŸ”” Uma seniqedile, beka uhlu lapho bonke abantu bazolubona khona nsuku zonke.

SourceText: ğŸ‰ As members of the family reach their goals, tick them off the list and celebrate each goal reached.
text: ğŸ‰ Njengoba amalunga omndeni afeza izifiso zabo, thikha kuhlu bese nibungaza isifiso esifezekile.

SourceText: â“ As the year goes on, there might be some items some of you have not achieved. Talk to your family about whether you still want to reach this goal or whether the goal has changed.
text: â“ Njengoba unyaka uqhubeka, kungenzeka ezinye izinto, abanye benu azifezekanga. Khuluma nomndeni wakho mayelana nokuthi usafuna ukufeza lesi sifiso noma isifiso sesishintshile.

SourceText: ğŸ”‘ If you still want to achieve the goal, discuss with your family what you need to do to tick the goal off your wish list.
text: ğŸ”‘ Uma usafuna ukufeza umgomo, xoxisana nomndeni wakho ngalokho okudingeka ukwenze ukuze ukhathule umgomo ohlwini lwakho lwezifiso.

SourceText: *Weekly Goal Setting*
text: *Ukulungiselelwa Komgomo Wamasonto onke*

SourceText: Letâ€™s set some goals â­
text: Asibeke esihlose ukukufeza â­

SourceText: â° It can be helpful to set smaller weekly goals that are easier to reach. This helps us reach our larger goals over time.
text: â° Kungaba usizo ukuzibekela izinhloso ezincane yamasonto onke okulula ukuyifinyelela. Lokhu kusisiza ukuthi sifinyelele imigomo yethu emikhulu ngokuhamba kwesikhathi.

SourceText: ğŸ’¡Ask your teen for one goal that they would like to achieve this week.
text: ğŸ’¡Buza ingane yakho inhloso eyodwa engathanda ukuwufinyelela kuleli sonto.

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Make sure this goal is *specific* and  *achievable* to reach in 1 week.
text: ğŸ”„ Qiniseka ukuthi le nhloso *iqondile* futhi *iyafinyeleleka* ukuze ifeze evikini elilodwa.

SourceText: ğŸ’š You can also share your own weekly goal with your teen and support each other so you can both achieve your goals.
text: ğŸ’š Ungakwazi futhi ukwabelana ngenhloso yakho weviki nomntwana wakho futhi nisekelane ukuze nobabili nifinyelele imigomo yenu.

SourceText: ğŸ‰ Make sure to praise and celebrate your teen for their hard work towards reaching their goal.
text: ğŸ‰ Qiniseka ukuthi uyayincoma futhi uyibungaze ingane yakho ngokusebenza kanzima ukuze ifeze inhloso yayo.

SourceText: ğŸ”” If your teen does not reach their goal, that is okay. Discuss with your teen the steps they still need to take or how they could reach it a different way.
text: ğŸ”” Uma umtwana wakho engafinyeleli kwinto ebeyihlosile, kulungile. Xoxisana nomtwana wakho ngezinyathelo asadinga ukuzithatha noma ukuthi angafinyelela kanjani kuzo ngendlela ehlukile.

SourceText: *Think Big, Think Small*
text: *Cabanga kakhulu, Cabanga kancane*

SourceText: Working towards big goals can be hard! Here is a way you can help your teen set new goals for the things they want to achieve. ğŸ‘‘
text: Ukusebenzela izifiso ezinkulu kungaba nzima! Nansi indlela ongasiza ngayo ingane yakho ukusetha izinhloso ezintsha abafuna ukuzifeza. ğŸ‘‘

SourceText: ğŸ‘‘ Ask your teen to come up with three things that they are good at, and discuss what they did to become so good at them. For example: keeping their room neat, helping your family with housework, or playing a sport.
text: ğŸ‘‘ Cela ingane yakho  ukuthi isho izinto ezintathu ezenza kahle, futhi nikhulume ngokuthi benzeni ukuze bazenze kahle. Isibonelo: ukugcina ikamelo labo niqoqekile, ukusiza umndeni wakho ngomsebenzi wasendlini, noma ukudlala ezemidlalo.

SourceText: ğŸ† Next, ask your teen what they wish they were good at.
text: ğŸ† Okulandelayo, buza ingane yakho ukuthi ifisa ukuthi ebemuhle ekuyenzeni ini.

SourceText: ğŸ”‘ Remind them that it took work and practice to become good at the skills they have. They will have to do the same for any new goal.
text: ğŸ”‘ Bakhumbuze ukuthi kwathatha umsebenzi nokuzijwayeza ukuze abemuhle kulamakhono anawo. Kufanele benze okufanayo kunoma isiphi isifiso esisha.

SourceText: â° Help your teen break down their goal and set up smaller goals they need to achieve to reach their greater goal.
text: â° Siza ingane yakho ukucozulula umgomo wakhe futhi azinqumele imigomo emincane abayidingayo ukufeza nokufinyelela kumgomo omkhulu.

SourceText: ğŸ“ It is much easier to achieve a goal if you write it down! This way, you can be reminded of it as you work towards it.
text: ğŸ“ Kulula kakhulu ukufeza isifiso uma usibhala phansi! Ngale ndlela, ungakhunjuzwa ngaso njengoba usebenzela ukufika kuso.

SourceText: â˜€ï¸ For example, if the goal is to be good at football, small weekly goals could be to go to football practice 2 times per week, run at least 1 km 5 times per week, and learn about the sport from other football players in the community or from books or videos they find.
text: â˜€ï¸ Isibonelo, uma inhloso ukuba umpetha ebholeni, izinhloso ezincane zesonto kungaba ukuya ebholeni kabili ngesonto, ugijime okungenani ikhilomitha kawu- 5 ngesonto, futhi ufunde ngebhola kwabanye abadlali bebhola emphakathini noma ezincwadini noma kumavidiyo abawatholayo.

SourceText: âœ… It is important to write down these smaller goals and let your teen tick off each task as they do them each week. Seeing themselves reach smaller goals will keep them motivated to achieve the big goal!
text: âœ… Kubalulekile ukubhala phansi le migomo emincane futhi uvumele ingane yakho ukuthi iphawule umsebenzi ngamunye njengoba iwenza isonto ngalinye. Ukuzibona befinyelela imigomo emincane kuzobagcina benogqozi lokufinyelela umgomo omkhulu!

SourceText: *Role Playing*
text: *Ukudlala indima*

SourceText: Letâ€™s start acting! â­
text: Masiqale ukulingisa! â­

SourceText: â“ Role playing common stressful social moments with your teen allows them to practise how to respond so they are prepared if this moment does happen. ğŸŒ·
text: â“ Ukulingisa kuba kujwayeleke ukuba izikhathi zengcindezi yezenhlalo ezinganeni ebavumela ukuphrakhthiza ukuthi uphendula kanjani ukuze bakulungele uma lokhu sekwenzeka ğŸŒ·

SourceText: âœ¨ Ask your teen if they want to role play with you. You can also suggest a topic. For example, asking someone on a date, saying no to drugs/alcohol/sexting, dealing with a bully, getting a bad grade, or dealing with gossip.
text: âœ¨ Buza umtwana wakho ukuthi uyafuna yini ukudlala indima nawe. Ungafaka isicelo sesihloko. Isibonelo, ukucela othile ukuzikhipha naye, ukungqaba izidakamizwa/utshwala/imiyalezo yocansi, ukubhekana nohlukumeza abanye, ukuthola amamaki amabi, noma ukubhekana nenhlebo.

SourceText: ğŸŒ™ Your teen could play the role of a friend asking you to drink at a party. You could role play an underage teen who does not want to drink. Encourage your teen to be silly and really get into character with them.
text: ğŸŒ™Umntwana wakho angalingisa indima yomngani okucela ukuthi uphuze ephathini. Wena ungalingisa indima yomntwana wakho ongafuni ukuphuza. Gqugquzela ingane yakho ukuthi abe isiphukuphuku futhi angeni esimeni ngokuphelele.

SourceText: â¯ï¸ After you act out the scene, it is important to talk to your teen about the actions that you role played. You can act out this scenario as many times as you like!
text: â¯ï¸ Ngemva kokulingisa indawo, kubalulekile ukukhuluma nomntwana wakho mayelana nezenzo ozililile. Ungalingisa lesi simo izikhathi eziningi ngokuthanda kwakho!

SourceText: *Traffic Lights*
text: * Izibani Zomgwaqo*

SourceText: A group activity is a great way to bond with others! ğŸ’›
text: Umsebenzi weqembu uyindlela enhle yokuhlangana nabanye! ğŸ’›

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ Choose one person to turn and face a wall. This will be the traffic officer.
text: ğŸ’¡ Khetha umuntu oyedwa ukuthi ajike abheke udonga. Lona kuzoba iphoyisa lomgwaqo.

SourceText: ğŸ Everyone else will begin the game at the other side of the room, or if you are outside, at a starting line. Set a long distance between the traffic officer and the players.
text: ğŸ Wonke umuntu uzoqala umdlalo engakolunye uhlangothi endlini, uma kwenzeka ungaphandle kumugqa wokuqala. Setha ibanga elikhulu phakathi kwephoyisa lomgwaqo nabadlali.

SourceText: ğŸ’š The game begins when the officer shouts â€œGreenâ€, and everyone can start moving towards the traffic officer at any speed they choose.
text: ğŸ’š Umdlalo uqala uma iphoyosa limemeza "Umbala oluhlaza", bese bonke abantu bangaqala ukusondela ephoyiseni lomgwaqo nganoma isiphi isivinini abasikhethayo.

SourceText: ğŸ”´ The officer can shout â€œRed!â€ at any time, without looking behind them. When they shout this, everyone must stop and freeze!
text: ğŸ”´ Iphoyisa lingamemeza lithi "Umbala obomvu!" nganoma isiphi isikhathi, ngaphandle kokubheka ngemuva. Uma limemeza lokhu, wonke umuntu kufanele ame futhi anganyakazi!

SourceText: â¸ The officer turns around to see if everyone is frozen. If they see anyone moving, they have to send them back to the start line.
text: â¸ Iphoyisa liyaphenduka ukubona ukuthi wonke umuntu akanyakazi. Uma ebona umuntu onyakazayo, kufanele amubuyisele emuva ayoqala phansi.

SourceText: ğŸ† The winner is the first person to get to the officer without being sent back to the start.
text: ğŸ† Umanqoba umuntu owokuqala ofika ephoyiseni ngaphandle kokubuyiselwa ekuqaleni.

SourceText: ğŸ‘‘ The winner then becomes the traffic officer and you can play another round!
text: ğŸ‘‘ Owinile ube eseba iphoyisa lomgwaqo futhi ungadlala omunye umzuliswano!
